histogram.summary: Tracks whether the idle logout warning was canceled or proceeded to logout. Note: the count of "shown" includes both cases, so the count of "shown and proceeded" is equal to "shown" minus "canceled".

histogram.name: DemoMode.ResourcesRemoval.Reason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason for removal of pre-install demo resources. To support offline demo mode, factory Chrome OS devices will have a set of offline enabled demo mode apps pre-installed. These resources are removed once they are not needed anymore.

histogram.name: DemoMode.ResourcesRemoval.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of requests to remove pre-installed demo resources. To support offline demo mode, factory Chrome OS devices will have a set of offline enabled demo mode apps pre-installed. These resources are removed once they are not needed anymore. This will record only requests that attempted deleting pre-installed resources from disk. Requests that fail early will be ignored. For example, a request will fail early if the device is in demo mode, or the resources have already been removed.

histogram.name: DemoMode.SessionLength
histogram.summary: A demo session starts when a user signs in using the policy-configured public account. It stops when the user signs out, either manually or after an idle timeout. Session length is the duration between the start and stop events. It is recorded during signing out and reported on the next chrome run. This metric tracks the recorded session length rounded down to the nearest minute and is capped at 2 hours.

histogram.name: DemoMode.Setup.DownloadDuration
histogram.summary: This records the time taken to download the demo mode resources when demo mode is setup for the first time.

histogram.name: DemoMode.Setup.EnrollDuration
histogram.summary: This records the time taken to enterprise-enroll the device when demo mode is setup for the first time.

histogram.name: DemoMode.Setup.LoadingDuration
histogram.summary: When demo mode is setup for the first time, it must download the demo mode resources and enterprise-enroll the device. This records the time taken for these two steps to complete. (See DemoMode.Setup.DownloadDuration and DemoMode.Setup.EnrollDuration)

histogram.name: DemoMode.Setup.NumRetries
histogram.summary: Records the number of times an operator has encountered an error during the loading screen and been required to retry setup. This is only recorded after setup completes successfully.

histogram.name: DemoMode.UniqueAppsLaunched
histogram.summary: Records how many unique apps have been launched by a user using the device during Demo mode. The sample is recorded when the DemoMode session closes.

histogram.name: DemoMode.UserClicksAndPresses
histogram.summary: Records how many times the user clicks mouse and presses screen in the demo session. During one demo session, if a mouse click or screen press happens, increment this metric by one.

histogram.name: DirectSockets.PermissionDeniedFailures
histogram.summary: Record how often each permission check (e.g. permissions policy, transient activation, user dialog, hostname resolving to non-public address, rate limiting, CORS, enterprise policy) cause Permission Denied failures. Recorded when the permission is denied.

histogram.name: DirectSockets.TCPNetworkFailures
histogram.summary: How often tcp socket opening finishes with a network failure.

histogram.name: DirectSockets.TCPServerNetworkFailures
histogram.summary: How often tcp server socket opening finishes with a network failure.

histogram.name: DirectSockets.UDPNetworkFailures
histogram.summary: How often udp socket opening finishes with a network failure.

histogram.name: DisplayManager.InternalDisplayZoomPercentage
histogram.summary: The zoom percentage that the user has set on the internal display and is actively using. This is emitted when the zoom factor has been updated in display manager and has not been changed for a while.

histogram.name: DisplayManager.MirroringImplementation
histogram.summary: The way in which mirroring is implemented, either in hardware or software. This is emitted once when mirroring is enabled through API call, or the display configuration changes ( e.g. adding or removing a display) when mirror mode is on.

histogram.name: DisplayManager.MirrorModeTypes
histogram.summary: The types of mirror mode in which the displays connected to the device are in. This is emitted once when the normal or mixed mirror mode is enabled through API call, or the display configuration changes ( e.g. adding or removing a display) when mirror mode is on.

histogram.name: DisplayManager.MultiDisplayMode
histogram.summary: The mode in which the connected displays to the device are in. This is emitted once when displays are added or removed, or when the user changes the mode by e.g. enabling mirror or unified modes.

histogram.name: DisplayManager.UnifiedDesktopDisplayCountRange
histogram.summary: The number of displays connected to the device when Unified Desktop mode is on. This is emitted when Unified Desktop mode is turned on, or the displays are added or removed while in Unified Mode.

histogram.name: DisplayManager.UpdateDisplayConfigurationTask.Success
histogram.summary:
Records whether or not the display configuration was successfully updated. Emitted when the update-display-configuration task finishes, successfully or not.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M102 to M117; data may be missing.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchResolution
histogram.summary: The duration of time used by the DNS pre-resolving threads to resolve a host name via the network. Any resolutions that are faster than 15ms are considered to be local cache hits, not requiring network access, and are not included in this histogram. This histogram is most useful for estimating the typical cost of a name resolution, but it also estimates the total number of network-based resolutions induced by this feature. Not all these resolutions prove helpful (i.e., the user does not always actually visit the resolved hostnames).

histogram.name: Document.BeforeUnloadDialog
histogram.summary:
Records result of invoking beforeunload handler, that determines whether to show the dialog.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M77 to M108; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Document.OutliveTimeAfterShutdown.DestroyedBeforeProcessDies
histogram.summary: Records the GC count between the time when the document is shut down and and the time when the document is actually destroyed. This only counts documents that are destroyed before the process dies.

histogram.name: Document.OutliveTimeAfterShutdown.GCCount
histogram.summary: Records documents that survives some GCs after the document is shut down.

histogram.name: DocumentEventTiming.BeforeUnloadDialogDuration.ByNavigation
histogram.summary:
Milliseconds spent in beforeunload dialog. Does not include time to process beforeunload event in JavaScript. Recorded immediately after closing dialog, upon user confirmation to navigate away from the page.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-09-05 to M108; data may be missing.

histogram.name: DocumentScan.ScanFailed
histogram.summary: Chrome OS document scan metric that tracks which SANE backend (effectively a scanner driver) was used when a scan failed.

histogram.name: DocumentScan.ScanFailureProgress
histogram.summary: Chrome OS document scan metric that tracks the stage at which the scan failed.

histogram.name: DocumentScan.ScanFailureReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS document scan metric that tracks the reason of a scan failure.

histogram.name: DocumentScan.ScanRequested
histogram.summary: Chrome OS document scan metric that tracks which SANE backend (effectively a scanner driver) that a user requested to use for a scan.

histogram.name: DocumentScan.ScanSucceeded
histogram.summary: Chrome OS document scan metric that tracks which SANE backend (effectively a scanner driver) was used when a scan succeeded.

histogram.name: Downgrade.CacheDirMove.FailureCount
histogram.summary: The number of items within the Cache directory that could not be moved aside following a downgrade. 0 indicates that the target directory could not be created.

histogram.name: Downgrade.CacheDirMove.Result
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not moving a user's cache dir following a downgrade succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Downgrade.InvalidSnapshotMove.FailureCount
histogram.summary: The number of items within from an invalid snapshot directory that could not be moved. 0 indicates that the target directory could not be created.

histogram.name: Downgrade.InvalidSnapshotMove.Result
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not moving an invalid snapshot directory succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Downgrade.RestoreSnapshot.CleanupAfterFailure.Result
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not cleaning up after a snapshot restoration failure succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Downgrade.RestoreSnapshot.FailureCount
histogram.summary: The number of items within from a snapshot directory that could not be restored following a downgrade.

histogram.name: Downgrade.RestoreSnapshot.Result
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not restoring a snapshot of the user data dir succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Downgrade.TakeSnapshot.FailureCount
histogram.summary: The number of items within the user data directory that could not be snapshotted following an upgrade.

histogram.name: Downgrade.TakeSnapshot.ItemFailure
histogram.summary: Indicates the id of an item that failed to be copied when taking a user data snapshot. The metrics does not cover the data from 12/12/2021 to 03/29/2022.

histogram.name: Downgrade.TakeSnapshot.MoveExistingSnapshot.FailureCount
histogram.summary: The number of items within an existing snapshot directory that could not be moved aside before replacing it with a newer snapshot.

histogram.name: Downgrade.TakeSnapshot.MoveExistingSnapshot.Result
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not moving a user data snapshot dir before replacing it with a newer snapshot succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Downgrade.TakeSnapshot.ProfileDirectoryCreation.Result
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not creating a profile directory while creating a user data snapshot succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Downgrade.TakeSnapshot.Result
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not creating a snapshot of the user data dir succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Downgrade.UserDataDirMove.FailureCount
histogram.summary: The number of items within User Data that could not be moved aside following a downgrade.

histogram.name: Downgrade.UserDataDirMove.Result
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not moving a user's User Data dir following a downgrade succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Drive.PushNotificationInitiallyEnabled
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the push notification is initially enabled for Drive. Recorded when the first notification is processed. Notification is emulated by polling if the push notication is disabled.

histogram.name: Drive.PushNotificationRegistered
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the push notification request is registered correctly for Drive. Recorded when the push notification manager is initialized.

histogram.name: DriveOffline.CrosAutoEnableOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2022-02 as this feature never launched.
histogram.summary: Outcome of enabling Google Drive offline mode automatically when a user first logs into a Chrome OS device. This process involves opening a hidden web page in the context of the Google Drive hosted app to perform the initialization of offline mode.

histogram.name: DrmUtil.CreateDisplaySnapshot.BitsPerChannel
histogram.summary: Number of bits per channel described by a parsed EDID blob. This UMA is recorded whenever the color space is extracted from an EDID blob. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-01-03 to 2023-05-17; data may be missing.

histogram.name: DrmUtil.CreateDisplaySnapshot.HasEdidBlob
histogram.summary: Whether an EDID blob was detected. This UMA is recorded whenever we attempt to parse the EDID from a display. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-01-03 to 2023-05-17; data may be missing.

histogram.name: DrmUtil.CreateDisplaySnapshot.IsHDR
histogram.summary: Whether a EDID blob contained an HDR transfer function (e.g. SMPT SE2084 or HLG). This UMA is recorded whenever the color space is extracted from an EDID blob. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-01-03 to 2023-05-17; data may be missing.

histogram.name: DrmUtil.GetColorSpaceFromEdid.ChecksOutcome
histogram.summary:
When attempting to get the color space from an EDID blob, whether the sanity checks passed (and if not, which check failed). This UMA is recorded whenever the color space is extracted from an EDID blob.
Expired in January 2022, and revived in June 2023 (M117). Data collected between those dates may be incomplete.

histogram.name: Eche.AppListUpdate.Latency
histogram.summary: This metric tracks the time it takes from the phone becoming connected to the Chromebook and sending the PhoneStatusSnapshot proto until the phone sends over the entire apps list via the AppListUpdate proto. Emitted after the app stream launcher loads the app list.

histogram.name: Eche.AppStream.LaunchAttempt
histogram.summary: This metric logs where the Eche app was launched from. The metric is emmited when the eche app is launched.

histogram.name: Eche.Connection.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration of time the phone is in the state connected to eche signaling service, and becomes disconnected.

histogram.name: Eche.Connection.Result
histogram.summary: Measures Eche connection success rate. This is recorded at the end of each connection attempt whether it fails or succeeds and the failure bucket is broken down to more specific segments in Eche.Connection.Result.FailureReason

histogram.name: Eche.Connection.Result.FailureReason
histogram.summary: The reason for which the connection attempt to the phone has failed. This is a breakdown of the failure bucket of Eche.Connection.Result and is recorded at the time a connection attempt fails.

histogram.name: Eche.Connectivity.Latency
histogram.summary: The duration of time the phone is in the state connecting to eche signaling service, and becomes connected.

histogram.name: Eche.MultiDeviceFeatureState
histogram.summary: Indicates the feature state of the Exo feature. This metric is emitted to at the creation of the user session (when the user logs in), when any multi-device feature state changes, and every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Eche.NetworkCheck.FailureReason
histogram.summary: Failure reason emitted by EcheSignaler on background connect attempt failures.

histogram.name: Eche.NetworkCheck.Result
histogram.summary: Emitted on success or failure of a background network connection attempt. Triggered when Phone Hub first connects, and on each bubble opened event.

histogram.name: Eche.NotificationClicked
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 11/2022. Replaced with Eche.AppStream.LaunchAttempt
histogram.summary: Events logged after the user interacts with a PhoneHub notification by clicking it to launch app streaming window.

histogram.name: Eche.Onboarding.UserAction
histogram.summary: Events logged the user action in the Eche onboarding. Recorded when users start Eche onboarding and grant the permission that onboarding needs.

histogram.name: Eche.StreamEvent
histogram.summary: Events logged in the Eche stream state. Records when a stream is started and initialized after the user interacts with a PhoneHub notification or the recent app by clicking it to launch the app streaming window.

histogram.name: Eche.StreamEvent.ConnectionFail
histogram.summary: Events logged the root cause of Eche connection failure. Records when signaling timeout on EcheSignaler or the tablet mode check on EcheTray.

histogram.name: Eche.StreamEvent.Duration.FromInitializeToClose
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time from when the stream is initializing to when the stream is closed before the stream doesn't started. Fires during the process of closing Eche streaming when the stream doesn't start. It is not sent on a successful connection attempt.

histogram.name: Eche.StreamEvent.FromLauncher
histogram.summary: Events logged in the Eche stream state. Records when a stream is initialized and started after the user clicks on an app from full app list (Launcher) to launch the app streaming window.

histogram.name: Eche.StreamEvent.FromNotification
histogram.summary: Events logged in the Eche stream state. Records when a stream is initialized and started after the user clicks on a PhoneHub notification to launch the app streaming window.

histogram.name: Eche.StreamEvent.FromNotification.PreviousNetworkCheckFailed.ConnectionFail
histogram.summary: Events logged the root cause of Eche connection failure when triggered from a notification and failed in last network connection check. Records when signaling timeout on EcheSignaler or the tablet mode check on EcheTray. Separate from Eche.StreamEvent.ConnectionFail.

histogram.name: Eche.StreamEvent.FromNotification.PreviousNetworkCheckFailed.Result
histogram.summary: Records the success rate of app streaming when triggered from notificaiton and failed in last network connection check. Recorded when the stream is initialized in EcheTray or when it starts in EcheStreamStatusChangeHandler. Separate from Eche.StreamEvent.

histogram.name: Eche.StreamEvent.FromRecentApps
histogram.summary: Events logged in the Eche stream state. Records when a stream is initialized and started after the user clicks on an app from recent app list to launch the app streaming window.

histogram.name: Eche.UniqueAppsStreamed.PerDay
histogram.summary: This metric tracks the number of unique apps the user attempts to launch an app stream. Emitted when the app stream is launched and the app has not been launched in the current session.

histogram.name: EphemeralTab.BottomSheet.CloseReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that the BottomSheet-based Ephemeral Tab panel was closed. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: EphemeralTab.CloseReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that the Ephemeral Tab panel was closed. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: EphemeralTab.Ctr
histogram.summary: Records whether the user fully opened the Ephemeral Tab panel when it was shown. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: EphemeralTab.CtrPeek
histogram.summary: Records whether the user opened the Ephemeral Tab panel beyond peeking state. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: EphemeralTab.DurationOpened
histogram.summary: Records the duration in milliseconds that the Ephemeral Tab was left open. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: EphemeralTab.DurationPeeked
histogram.summary: Records the duration in milliseconds that the Ephemeral Tab was peeking. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: ExploreSites.CategoryClick
histogram.summary:
The number of times the user clicked on a site in a category with the selected type on the Explore Sites page.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: ExploreSites.ClickedNTPCategoryIndex
histogram.summary: 0-based index of a category tile on NTP which was clicked by the user. Indices are assigned by counting category tiles left-to-right, top-to-bottom as they appear on NTP. Recorded on click.

histogram.name: ExploreSites.ExploreSitesStore.StoreEvent
histogram.summary: Counts when the explore sites store is opened or closed.

histogram.name: ExploreSites.ImageDecoded
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of image decoding for the favicons.

histogram.name: ExploreSites.MonthlyHostCount
histogram.summary: Number of unique hosts visited by the user during the last 30 days. Reported at most once a week for all users on Android only, with a 5 second delay after startup. This is different from History.MonthlyHostCount which is reported for a percentage of startups, to avoid bias toward more active users.

histogram.name: ExploreSites.NavBackTime
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a user navigates out of the explore sites page and comes back to it within 30 seconds on the same tab. This is used to measure accidental clicks, where we expect users who navigate to the wrong page will navigate back to the ExploreSites page immediately afterward.

histogram.name: ExploreSites.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Reported each time from the result callback of the ExploreSitesFetcher. Values include Success and several failure codes.

histogram.name: FactoryPingEmbargo.EndDateValidity
histogram.summary: Record the validity of |rlz_embargo_end_date| in RW_VPD. This is recorded when the VPD value is accessed, which may be multiple times in the same chrome invocation. This is not recorded when the VPD value is missing.

histogram.name: Favicon.OnDemandIconExistsInDb
histogram.summary: Records whether an icon already existed in the thumbnail DB when downloading an on-demand one. On-demand icons are the ones added to local cache without the user visiting the corresponding page.

histogram.name: Favicons.LargeIconService.BlacklistedURLMismatch
histogram.summary: Records the number of large icons that were fetched from the local cache (e.g. during NTP impression), where the URL (of the page or the icon) matches a hardcoded blacklist. Suspicious mismatches are reported as errors.

histogram.name: Favicons.LargeIconService.DownloadedSize
histogram.summary: Records the size (concretely the width) in pixel of the favicon downloaded from Google favicon server (size 0 denotes that download has failed).

histogram.name: Favicons.LargeIconService.FallbackSize
histogram.summary: Records the size (concretely the width) in pixel of the favicon that is used to generate a fallback style in the case when large enough favicon is not available (size 0 denotes that no favicon is available at all).

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.CanContactUser
histogram.summary: Records whether users allow Google to contact them about the issues. Fires when feedback report is being sent.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.DescriptionLength
histogram.summary: Record the length of description in the textbox. Fires when the feedback report is being sent.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.Duration.GetBigFeedbackLogs
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time from the start of fetching Debugd logs via the GetBigFeedbackLogs dbus method to when the data has been retrieved. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome OS, or when the user previews the system logs from the feedback app on Chrome OS. GetBigFeedbackLogs is the dbus method used.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.ExitPath
histogram.summary: Records a summary of the actions the user took before exiting the app. Fires when user closes the feedback app, case includes: User quits on search page after clicking some help contents; User quits on search page without clicking some help contents; User closes on search page because no help content is shown(Offline or Search is down); User closes on share data page after clicking help content; User closes on share data page without clicking help content; User submits feedback after clicking the help content; User submits feedback without clicking the help content.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.GetBigFeedbackLogs.EmptyCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of logs with empty data retrieved from debugd for feedback reports. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome OS, or when the user previews the system logs from the feedback app on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.GetBigFeedbackLogs.NotAvailableCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of logs with not available data retrieved from debugd for feedback reports. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome OS, or when the user previews the system logs from the feedback app on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.GetBigFeedbackLogs.OtherCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of logs with data not empty or not available retrieved from debugd for feedback reports. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome OS, or when the user previews the system logs from the feedback app on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.GetBigFeedbackLogs.Success
histogram.summary: Records the success status of fetching the feedback logs via debus method GetBigFeedbackLogs. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome OS, or when the user previews the system logs from the feedback app on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.GetFeedbackLogsV2.DBusResult
histogram.summary: Records the different results of fetching the feedback logs via debus method GetFeedbackLogsV2. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome OS, or when the user previews the system logs from the feedback app on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.HelpContentOutcome
histogram.summary: Record the outcome of checking help contents. Fires when user leaves the search page by clicking continue or by clicking x on top right to close the app.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.HelpContentSearchResultCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of help content results returned in each search. Fires when user clicks and views the help content on search page.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.IncludedEmail
histogram.summary: Records whether the email is included when the feedback report is submitted. Fires when user's feedback report is being sent.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.IncludedFile
histogram.summary: Records whether attached file is included when the feedback report is submitted. Fires when user's feedback report is being sent.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.IncludedScreenshot
histogram.summary: Records whether the screenshot is included when the feedback report is submitted. Fires when a user's feedback report is successfully sent.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.IncludedSystemInfo
histogram.summary: Records whether the system and information is included when the feedback report is submitted. Fires when a user's feedback report is being sent.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.IncludedUrl
histogram.summary: Records whether the page url is included when the feedback report is submitted. Fires when user's feedback report is being sent.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.Openduration
histogram.summary: Records the duration that the Feedback App is open. Emitted when the app is closed.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.PostSubmitAction
histogram.summary: Records the first action that the users take after sending feedback. Fires on the first action taken on post submit page after the user has sent the feedback.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.TimeOnPage.{FeedbackAppPage}
Feedback.ChromeOSApp.ViewedHelpContent
histogram.summary: Record number of times the user viewed the help content. Fires when user clicks help content on search page.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.ViewedImage
histogram.summary: Record number of times the user viewed the attached image. Fires when user clicks the thumbnail and views the larger image.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.ViewedMetrics
histogram.summary: Record number of times the user viewed the metrics. Fires when user clicks metrics link and views metrics.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.ViewedScreenshot
histogram.summary: Record number of times the user viewed the screenshot. Fires when user clicks the thumbnail on and views the larger screenshot.

histogram.name: Feedback.ChromeOSApp.ViewedSystemAndAppInfo
histogram.summary: Record number of times the user viewed the system and app information. Fires when system and app info link is clicked.

histogram.name: Feedback.Duration.FetchSystemInformation
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time from the start of fetching system information to when the data has been retrieved. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome (Desktop + Android) or Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.Duration.FormOpenToSubmit
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time from when the feedback app window is opened to when the backend receives the send report request submitted by a user. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome (Desktop + Android) or Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.Duration.FormSubmitToConfirmation
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time from when the backend receives the send report request submitted by a user to when it starts to send confirmation back to the frontend. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome or Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.Duration.FormSubmitToSendQueue
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time from when the backend receives the send report request submitted by a user and the report has been added to the send queue. Fires during the process of sending a feedback report on Chrome or Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Feedback.HappinessTrackingSurvey.BubbleUsage
histogram.summary: Records how user interacts with Happiness Tracking Surveys (HaTS) bubble prompt which is shown for a subset of users. Each time when the bubble is shown, there should be one and only one enum type is recorded.

histogram.name: Feedback.HappinessTrackingSurvey.ShouldShowSurveyReason
histogram.summary: Records the first reason why the Happiness Tracking Surveys (HaTS) bubble was or was not shown. While the request to show may not meet multiple criteria, the first criterion is reported here.

histogram.name: Feedback.RedactionTool
histogram.summary: Records how many times PIIs are redacted by the Client side log redaction tool.

histogram.name: Feedback.RedactionTool.CreditCardMatch
histogram.summary: The redaction tool can be used to redact potential PII on the client side before logs and other data is sent to servers. This histogram is recorded when attempting to verify if a matched string is a credit card. Since we don't have guaranteed context for credit cards in our logs, unlike e.g. shill log format, we have to do apply some heuristic. There are several steps where the validation could detect a false positive and we want to measure how effective these mechanisms are.

histogram.name: Feedback.RedactionTool.TimeSpentRedacting
histogram.summary: Records how many milliseconds elapsed while redacting the input text by the redaction_tool. This metric is recorded after each redaction (JS error or feedback report). This metric should be a rough control so we aren't running a very long time in the background after a report.

histogram.name: Feedback.RedactionTool.TimeSpentRedactingCrash
histogram.summary: Records how many milliseconds elapsed while redacting the logs of a crash inside ChromeOS's crash_reporter. This metric is recorded for each crash that has text logs that need redaction, at the time the crash happens. This metric should be a rough control so we aren't running a very long time after a crash and the user has to wait for the frozen screen to disappear.

histogram.name: Feedback.ReportSending.Online
histogram.summary: Records whether the user is online when the feedback report was submitted.

histogram.name: Feedback.ReportSending.Result
histogram.summary: Records the feedback report sending states to help track the success rate of feedback report offline submission.

histogram.name: Feedback.RequestSource
histogram.summary: Records the source that requested showing the feedback app.

histogram.name: Feedback.TrustSafetySentiment.CallTriggerOccurred
histogram.summary: Records the associated feature area when the Trust and Safety sentiment service detects that the user has performed a trigger action. This is recorded before the associated probability check and will be used to verify the infrastructure of newly integrated feature areas. We will remove this histogram once we verify the implementation.

histogram.name: Feedback.TrustSafetySentiment.SurveyRequested
histogram.summary: Records the associated feature area when the Trust and Safety Sentiment service requests a survey be shown from the HaTS service.

histogram.name: Feedback.TrustSafetySentiment.TriggerOccurred
histogram.summary: Records the associated feature area when the Trust and Safety sentiment service detects that the user has performed a trigger action. This is recorded after the associated probability check.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Metrics
histogram.summary: Recorded once every time a Fetch keepalive request is either aborted, failed to load, or succeed to load in browser.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total
histogram.summary:
Recorded true every time a new Fetch keepalive request is created by a browser. It does NOT equal to the total number of JavaScript Fetch keepalive call, as the latter can be immediately rejected with various JavaScript exceptions.
This number should be compared with `FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total`.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Finished
histogram.summary:
Recorded once every time a FetchLater request loading is finished in browser. A finished loading can be either suceeded or failed.
This number may be <= `FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Started`, as a request may be dropped for other undocumented reasons like browser killed or crashes. Also, this number is ~= `kLoadingSuceeded` + `kLoadingFailed` in `FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Metrics`.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.ReceivedResponse
histogram.summary:
Recorded once every time a Fetch keepalive request loader in browser has received a response.
This number should be compared with `FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.ReceivedResponse`.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Redirected
histogram.summary:
Recorded once every time a Fetch keepalive request loader in browser has received a redirect.
This number should be compared with `FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.Redirected`.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Started
histogram.summary: Recorded once every time a created Fetch keepalive request is started in the browser. This number should be the same as `FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total`, but logging to figure out if any differneces exist.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Metrics
histogram.summary: Recorded once every time a Fetch keepalive request is either aborted or dropped in renderer.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total
histogram.summary:
Recorded true every time a new FetchLater request is created by a renderer. It does NOT equal to the total number of JavaScript FetchLater API call, as the latter can be immediately rejected with various JavaScript exceptions.
This metric is recorded to compare whether different behavior happens between renderer and browser. This number should be compared with `FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total`.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.Finished
histogram.summary:
Recorded once every time a Fetch keepalive request loading is finished in a renderer process. A finished loading can be either suceeded or failed.
This number may be <= `FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.Started`, as a request may be dropped for other undocumented reasons like browser killed or crashes. Also, this number is <= `FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Finished`.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.ReceivedResponse
histogram.summary:
Recorded once every time a Fetch keepalive request loader in a renderer has received a response.
This number should be compared with `FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.ReceivedResponse`.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.Redirected
histogram.summary:
Recorded once every time a Fetch keepalive request loader in a renderer has received a redirect.
This number should be compared with `FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Redirected`.

histogram.name: FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.Started
histogram.summary:
Recorded once every time a created Fetch keepalive request is started in a renderer process.
This number may be <= `FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total`, as a created request may not be started at all.

histogram.name: FetchLater.Browser.Metrics
histogram.summary: Records once every time a scheduled FetchLater request is either aborted or started in browser.

histogram.name: FetchLater.Browser.Total
histogram.summary:
Records true every time a new FetchLater request is scheduled by a browser. It does NOT equal to the total number of JavaScript FetchLater API call, as the latter can be immediately rejected with various JavaScript exceptions.
This number should be compared with `FetchLater.Renderer.Total`, and it may be >= the sum of `FetchLater.Browser.Metrics`, as a request may be dropped for other undocumented reasons like browser killed or crashes.

histogram.name: FetchLater.Browser.Total.Started
histogram.summary:
Records once every time a scheduled FetchLater request is started in browser.
This number should be the sum of enum values "kStarted*" in `FetchLater.Browser.Metrics`.

histogram.name: FetchLater.Renderer.Metrics
histogram.summary: Records once every time a scheduled FetchLater request is either aborted or activated in renderer.

histogram.name: FetchLater.Renderer.Total
histogram.summary:
Records true every time a new FetchLater request is scheduled by a renderer. It does NOT equal to the total number of JavaScript FetchLater API call, as the latter can be immediately rejected with various JavaScript exceptions.
This metric is recorded to compare whether different behavior happens between renderer and browser. This number should be compared with `FetchLater.Browser.Total`, and it should be equal to the sum of `FetchLater.Renderer.Metrics`.

histogram.name: FirstPartySets.Database.InitStatus
histogram.summary: Records initialization status of First-Party Sets database. Recorded when the database is lazily initialised when the first operation is encountered.

histogram.name: FirstPartySets.Initialization.ClearSiteDataOutcome
histogram.summary: Measures the outcome of site data clearing. Recorded when First-Party Sets initialization triggers site data clearing for a given browser context.

histogram.name: FirstPartySets.Initialization.SitesToClear.Count
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of sites whose data should be cleared during Related Website Sets initialization. (Note: this doesn't record the number of sites whose data *was* cleared.)
Recorded once per profile during profile login.

histogram.name: FirstPartySets.NavigationThrottle.ResumeDelta
histogram.summary: Measures the length of time between when a navigation was deferred and then resumed due to timeout or First-Party Sets is ready. Recorded when a deferred navigation is resumed.

histogram.name: FirstPartySets.NavigationThrottle.ResumeOnTimeout
histogram.summary: Measures the deferred navigations that are resumed due to timeout. Recorded when a deferred navigation is resumed.

histogram.name: FirstRun.IOSFirebaseConfigured
histogram.summary: Track whether Firebase is enabled or not at app startup.

histogram.name: FirstRun.LaunchSource
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times First Run experience was triggered by another application launching Chrome. This metric measures the effectiveness of Smart App Banner promotions on installation of Chrome.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.GoogleAppsInteraction
histogram.summary:
Records when a user interacted with the Google Apps new user experience. We record both accept and reject but are not recording when a user ignored the prompt completely. Users can ignore this prompt by closing the tab or navigating away, we record when the prompt is shown.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M76 to M100; data may be missing.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.GoogleAppsSelection
histogram.summary:
Records what Google apps were selected as part of the Google Apps New User Experience. Histogram is only recorded when a user accepts the prompt to add Google Apps.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M76 to M100; data may be missing.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.LandingPageInteraction
histogram.summary: Records when a user interacted with the landing page of the onboarding process. We record that the page was seen and what action the user took.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.NtpBackgroundInteraction
histogram.summary: Records when a user interacts with the NTP Backgrounds new user experience. We record the number of times the page is seen, how they interacted with the page (i.e. interacted with the options and buttons), and through what method they leave the page (i.e, confirm, cancel, neither). The new user experience should only be shown once to new profiles.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.NtpBackgroundLoadTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to load a NTP background image for preview. This is recorded when a user clicks on a background to preview and the full-size version of the background finishes loading.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.SetAsDefaultInteraction
histogram.summary: Records when a user interacted with the set default page of the onboarding process. We record that the page was seen and what action the user took.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.SignInInterstitialInteraction
histogram.summary:
Records when a user interacted with the sign in interstitial of the onboarding process. We record that the page was seen and what action the user took.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M76 to M100; data may be missing.

histogram.name: FirstRun.Sentinel.Created
histogram.summary:
Records the result of an attempt to create the first run sentinel file.
On iOS, file system errors are detailed further by the FirstRun.Sentinel.CreatedFileError histogram.

histogram.name: FirstRun.Sentinel.CreatedFileError
histogram.summary: File error when the sentinel file was not written.

histogram.name: FirstRun.SignIn
histogram.summary: Result of the sign in flow during first run on iOS.

histogram.name: FirstRun.Stage
histogram.summary: When Chrome is opened for the first time, the first run (onboarding) UI will be shown. Metircs will be recorded in different first run stages such as when first run experience is started, and when first run experience is completed.

histogram.name: FirstUserAction.BackgroundTime
histogram.summary:
WARNING: The list of actions used to identify new tasks hasn't been attentively updated for several years (as of 2017). Some actions that should likely be considered new tasks are probably missing. Take this histogram with a grain of salt. Was expired for M85, M86.
The amount of time (in seconds) that the app was in the background before the user started it

histogram.name: FirstUserAction.HandsetUserActionType
histogram.summary:
WARNING: The list of actions used to identify new tasks hasn't been attentively updated for several years (as of 2017). Some actions that should likely be considered new tasks are probably missing. Take this histogram with a grain of salt. Was expired for M77-M86.
On handsets, the type of the first user action performed after the app was started or unbackgrounded.

histogram.name: FirstUserAction.TabletUserActionType
histogram.summary:
WARNING: The list of actions used to identify new tasks hasn't been attentively updated for several years (as of 2017). Some actions that should likely be considered new tasks are probably missing. Take this histogram with a grain of salt. Was expired for M82-M86.
On tablets, the type of the first user action performed after the app was started or unbackgrounded.

histogram.name: FontFallback.GetLinkedFonts.CacheMissTiming
histogram.summary: Time to retrieve the fallback fonts on the system when not found in cache.

histogram.name: FontFallback.GetLinkedFonts.FontCount
histogram.summary: The amount of font returned for a given font family.

histogram.name: FontFallback.GetLinkedFonts.Timing
histogram.summary: Time to retrieve the fallback fonts on the system.

histogram.name: Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.DuplicateFontCount
histogram.summary: The number of duplicate fonts returned by system APIs. This is recorded when fonts are enumerated to be returned to script as a result of a call to the Font Access API.

histogram.name: Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.Dwrite.FamilyCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of font families observed by the font enumeration cache as part of the Font Access API.

histogram.name: Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.Dwrite.GetSystemFontCollectionResult
histogram.summary: Records errors returned when obtaining the list of system fonts from DirectWrite's GetSystemFontCollection.

histogram.name: Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.Dwrite.MostFrequentEnumerationFailure
histogram.summary: Records the most frequent failure to obtain metadata for a font family when enumerating fonts as part of the Font Access API. Recorded in FontEnumerationCacheWin when all fonts have been enumerated. Values are Windows HRESULT error codes, and also includes custom values specific to this implementation.

histogram.name: Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.Fontconfig.DuplicateFontCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M86 in favor of Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.DuplicateFontCount.
histogram.summary: The number of duplicate fonts returned by fontconfig.

histogram.name: Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.Fontconfig.FontCount
histogram.summary: The number of fonts returned by fontconfig.

histogram.name: Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.Fontconfig.IncompleteFontCount
histogram.summary: The number of fonts whose name table entries could not be read.

histogram.name: Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationTime
histogram.summary: Time spent enumerating fonts.

histogram.name: ForceDiceMigration.RevokeTokenAction
histogram.summary: Tracks revoke actions taken by the account reconcilior to force Dice migration. To enforce consistency, the reconcilior may invalidate the primary account or revoke one or more secondary account tokens, if no equivalent valid gaia cookie exist for those accounts.

histogram.name: Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.NetErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Reports the network error code for requests to the ListAccounts Gaia endpoint.

histogram.name: Gaia.ResponseCodesForOAuth2AccessToken
histogram.summary: URLFetcher response codes for OAuth2AccessToken. Positive values are HTTP status codes, negative values are network error codes. Recorded on responses to OAuth access token requests.

histogram.name: Gaia.ResponseForOAuth2AccessToken
histogram.summary: Records the result of the Oauth2 access token request when a response is received from the LSO server except in net failure cases. In error cases, it records the error code in the response body.

histogram.name: Gamepad.KnownGamepadConnectedWithId
histogram.summary: Records an integer value that can be used to identify a connected gamepad device. The value is constructed from the 16-bit vendor ID in the high-order bytes and the 16-bit product ID in the low-order bytes, then cast to a 32-bit signed integer. The GamepadVendorProduct enum lists IDs for several popular gamepads but is incomplete. To identify a device not included in the enum, convert back to the vendor/product IDs and look up the human-friendly product name in go/gamepad-ids. This histogram records a new entry when a device with a vendor and product ID matching a known gaming input device is detected during Gamepad API enumeration.

histogram.name: Gamepad.UnknownGamepadConnected
histogram.summary: Records an enumeration value identifying the active data fetcher when a fetcher enumerates a device that is not on the list of known gamepads, but is recognized as a gamepad by the fetcher.

histogram.name: GData.AuthSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Result of the authentication for Drive.

histogram.name: GestureNavigation.Type
histogram.summary: Gesture navigation type. It can be either Chrome's own gesture UI that supports back and forward navigation or OS-provided default system gesture navigation that supports only back action on both left and right edge. This is recorded on Chrome startup at the feature component initialization.

histogram.name: GridTabSwitcher.FramePerSecond
histogram.summary: This histogram records the frame rate of the transition animation between Tab and Grid Tab Switcher.

histogram.name: GridTabSwitcher.MaxFrameInterval
histogram.summary: This histogram records the maximum interval between rendered frames during the transition animation between Tab and Grid Tab Switcher.

histogram.name: GridTabSwitcher.ThumbnailFetchingResult
histogram.summary: This histogram records the result of thumbnail fetching in the Grid Tab Switcher.

histogram.name: GridTabSwitcher.{MessageType}.DisableReason
histogram.summary: Records why the {MessageType} is disabled in GridTabSwitcher and will no longer be shown to users. Recorded when the message is disabled. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Hardware.Concurrency
histogram.summary: Records the system hardware concurrency collected in the info collection GPU process, once per UMA ping. For most systems, it is equivalent to the number of CPU cores.

histogram.name: Hardware.Display.Count.OnChange
histogram.summary: The number of displays present right after the user has attached or detached a new display. Excludes mirrored displays, but includes sleeping displays.

histogram.name: Hardware.Display.Count.OnStartup
histogram.summary: The number of displays present at start up. Excludes mirrored displays, but includes sleeping displays.

histogram.name: Hardware.Display.SupportsHDR
histogram.summary: Whether a given display device supports HDR (such that the CSS media query `dynamic-range: high` would resolve as true). Recorded upon browser startup (for every connected display), upon display device connection (for the newly connected display), and upon any change to the color space metric (for the affected display).

histogram.name: Hardware.TotalDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Records a rough estimation of the system total disk space collected in the info collection GPU process, once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.OOBEDevicesDetectedOnContinuePressed
histogram.summary: Which HID were detected when user pressed Continue on OOBE dialog. This metric is specific to Chrome OS.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.OOBEDialogShown
histogram.summary: Whether HID detection dialog was shown on OOBE. Logged on screen show or on screen skip respectively. This metric is specific to Chrome OS.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.TimesDialogShownPerOOBECompleted
histogram.summary: Records number of times the dialog was shown by the time OOBE is completed. This metric is specific to Chrome OS.

histogram.name: HostedAppFrame.ContentSettings.ImagePressed
histogram.summary: Counts which content setting buttons in the hosted app frame are pressed by the user.

histogram.name: Hwsec.Attestation.PrepareDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of preparation for enrollment in attestation.

histogram.name: Hwsec.Attestation.Status
histogram.summary: The result of attestation-related operations on the Chrome OS side.

histogram.name: Hyphenation.Open
histogram.summary: The time it takes to open a hyphenation dictionary.

histogram.name: Hyphenation.Open.File
histogram.summary: The time it takes to open a hyphenation dictionary file.

histogram.name: Import.ImportedHistorySize.AutoImportFromIE
histogram.summary: The size of the history on Auto Import from IE. This measure is only logged on a succesfull Auto Import.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.AutoImport
histogram.summary:
The importer used on first run Auto Import.
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2018-09 to 2023-07; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.BookmarksAPI
histogram.summary:
The importer used on import from the bookmarks file API.
Warning: This histogram was expired from M77 to M117; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.ImportDataHandler
histogram.summary:
The importer used on import from the chrome://settings/importData UI.
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2018-09 to 2023-07; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileReplaceRetryCount
histogram.summary: The number of retries needed to successfully move the temporary file to its final location. Zero means that ReplaceFile worked the first time. Ten means that it never succeeded.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.SerializationDuration{ImportantFileClients}
histogram.summary: CPU time used in the foreground thread (usually UI thread) to serialize the data to be written into an important file (e.g. serialize JSON string for preferences). For users of ImportantFileWriter that leverage background serialization (e.g. bookmarks), it excludes the time spent on the background thread, and only logs the time spent on the foreground thread.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.WriteDuration{ImportantFileClients}
histogram.summary: CPU time used in the background thread to write serialized data into an important file. Recorded when the file is written.

histogram.name: Incognito.ClearBrowsingDataDialog.ActionType
histogram.summary: Records the action taken by the user on the Incognito clear browsing data dialog.

histogram.name: IncognitoModePrefs.WindowsParentalControlsInitThread
histogram.summary: The thread used to initialize the Windows parental controls.

histogram.name: IncognitoModePrefs.WindowsParentalControlsInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during a run of PlatformParentalControlsValue::IsParentalControlActivityLoggingOnImpl on Windows 7 and above.

histogram.name: IncompatibleApplicationsPage.AddedPostCrash
histogram.summary: Records whether the user was automatically shown the chrome://settings/incompatibleApplications page following a Chrome crash.

histogram.name: IncompatibleApplicationsPage.NumApplications
histogram.summary: The number of incompatible applications detected by Chrome at the time the chrome://settings/incompatibleApplications page was opened.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_LINEAR_ACCELERATION was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerIncGravityAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_ACCELEROMETER was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_ACCELEROMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Motion on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.DeviceOrientationSensorAndroid
histogram.summary: Provides a histogram of the base sensors (if any) that are used at the start of the Device Orientation API. Currently Sensor.TYPE_GAME_ROTATION_VECTOR is the default sensor for orientation, if it's not available fall-back options are provided by using either Sensor.TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR or a combination of Sensor.TYPE_ACCELEROMETER and Sensor.TYPE_MAGNETIC_FIELD.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.GyrometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_GYROMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Motion on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.GyroscopeAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_GYROSCOPE was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.InclinometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_INCLINOMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Orientation on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.MotionDefaultAvailable
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of Device Motion API invocations in the default implementation (Linux and CrOS). The default implementation does not provide any sensors so the result is always false.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.MotionMacAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the sudden motion sensor was available at the start of Device Motion on the MacOS platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.OrientationDefaultAvailable
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of Device Orientation API invocations in the default implementation (Linux and CrOS). The default implementation does not provide any sensors so the result is always false.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.OrientationMacAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the sudden motion sensor was available at the start of Device Orientation on the MacOS platform.

histogram.name: InstanceID.DeleteToken.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of DeleteToken request.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.CompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete the GetToken request successfully. If the request is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.NetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Net error code from an Instance ID GetToken attempt. Recorded when URL loading completes.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.OptionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of options provided to the GetToken request. Recorded when the request has been received by the InstanceID instance.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of GetToken request. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-08-06 to 2023-09-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.RequestStatus.FcmInvalidations
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of GetToken request for FCM invalidations (subtype was "com.google.chrome.fcm.invalidations").

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.RequestStatus.SyncInvalidations
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of GetToken request for Sync invalidations (subtype was "com.google.chrome.sync.invalidations").

histogram.name: IPC.AttachmentBrokerPrivileged.BrokerAttachmentError
histogram.summary: Errors that the privileged attachment broker encounters while trying to broker attachments.

histogram.name: IPC.AttachmentBrokerUnprivileged.BrokerAttachmentError
histogram.summary: Errors that an unprivileged attachment broker encounters while trying to broker attachments.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.OnBeforeUnloadStayVsLeave
histogram.summary: For onbeforeunload dialogs, the user's choice between staying on the page and leaving it.

histogram.name: Launch.FlagsAtStartup
histogram.summary: Logs which Chrome flags from about:flags were active on start up. Android WebView supports flags differently than most platforms, see https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/android_webview/docs/developer-ui.md for details.

histogram.name: Launch.Mode2
histogram.summary: The different ways Chrome is launched. This replaces Launch.Modes. Emitted once at startup, when the user launches Chrome to browse the web or launch a Web App. It is not recorded if Chrome is launched in other ways: by the installer, after an update, after a flag change, after an OS update, to install/uninstall/list apps, or in background mode.

histogram.name: Launch.Modes
histogram.summary:
The different ways Chrome is launched.
This metric is gradually being replaced with an improved version. See tracking bug http://crbug.com/1366137
Warnings about this version of this metric.
1. If user starts Chrome while Chrome is already running, this reports incorrect data. See http://crbug.com/1067205
2. On ChromeOS, if a user session-restores multiple profiles, each profile records this metric. See http://crbug.com/1356222
3. When the profile picker is shown on startup (which can only happen on Windows, Mac, and Linux), this metric is not recorded. See http://crbug.com/1380458

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerComplexText
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were complex text fragments, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerFloat
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were floats, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerNode
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerPositioned
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were fixed or absolute positioned, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerSimpleText
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were simple text fragments, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerTD
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were table cells, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.AdjustedScrollOffset
histogram.summary: Records the number of times ScrollAnchor adjusts the scroll offset.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.RestorationStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of attempts to restore a serialized scroll anchor.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.SerializedAnchorSelectorLength
histogram.summary: The number of characters in the selector computed for a serialized scroll anchor. Recorded when a scroll anchor is serialized.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.SuppressedBySanaclap
histogram.summary: Records the number of times scroll anchoring is suppressed because of the SANACLAP bit being set on an ancestor (see bit.ly/sanaclap).

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.TimeToComputeAnchorNodeSelector
histogram.summary:
The time it took to compute the selector of a serialized anchor element.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.TimeToFindAnchor
histogram.summary:
The time it took to find a suitable anchor element.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.TimeToRestoreAnchor
histogram.summary:
The time it took to restore the scroll anchor using the serialized anchor element.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.ClassificationTime
histogram.summary: Logged the end to end latency of the Lens image classifcation call when the user completes a long press on an image. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.ClassificationTime.EarlyTerminatedMs
histogram.summary: Logged the time between the start of the Lens image classifcation call to the early termination before the call completes. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.ClassificationTime.SuccessOnQueryResultMs
histogram.summary: Logged the end to end latency of the Lens image classifcation call when the user completes a long press on an image. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.ResultState
histogram.summary: Logged the result state of the Lens image classifcation call when the user completes a long press on an image. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.SdkError
histogram.summary: Logged the error code when there is a Lens SDK error occurred within the classification session. The error code is an integer constant defined by the SDK. Only logged on Android. See http://b/170422682 for more details.

histogram.name: Lens.Omnibox.LensSupportStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the user supports the camera assisted search with Google Lens and if not, the reason why. Recorded only if the feature is enabled when the omnibox or the new tab page is loaded.

histogram.name: Lens.QuickActionSearchWidget.LensSupportStatus
histogram.summary:
Whether the user supports the camera assisted search with Google Lens and if not, the reason why. Recorded only when the Lens button is tapped on the Quick Action Search Widget.
Note: Gap between 04/22 - 08/23.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.LoadNativeLibraryWindows
histogram.summary: This metric records the LoadLibraryExW and LoadLibraryW Windows API call results, which are used in native_library_win.cc.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.PercentageOfResidentCodeBeforePrefetch
histogram.summary: Percentage of the native library code pages resident in memory. Recorded immediately before the library prefetching kicks in, only on Android.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.Debian
histogram.summary: The Debian version number (eg. 8: Jessie, 9: Stretch). Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro3 is Debian.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.Fedora
histogram.summary: The Fedora version number (eg. 27, 28) Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro3 is Fedora.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.Mint
histogram.summary: The Linux Mint version number (eg. 20, 20.1) Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro3 is Mint.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.OpenSuseLeap
histogram.summary: The openSUSE Leap version number, logged as 1000*major + minor (eg. 15001 = 15.1). Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro3 is openSUSE Leap.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.Ubuntu
histogram.summary: The Ubuntu version number, logged as 1000*year + month (eg. 16004 = 16.04 Xenial). Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro3 is Ubuntu.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro3
histogram.summary: The Linux distro used. Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.GlibcVersion
histogram.summary: The version of glibc used. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.ProxyLocaltimeCallToBrowserUs
histogram.summary: The time taken for localtime_r() call to proxied from a sandboxed process to the browser and a response returned back in microseconds. This histogram is only recorded on Linux, where all users have high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Linux.SandboxStatus
histogram.summary: The Linux sandbox status. This describes what sandboxing features are enabled (such as the suid/namespace sandboxes, various namespaces, seccomp bpf, ...). Emitted once at startup.

histogram.name: Linux.SystemTheme.Default
histogram.summary: The default system theme. Logged once on startup.

histogram.name: Linux.SystemTheme.Profile
histogram.summary: The per-profile system theme. Logged once for each profile on startup, and whenever the system theme changes.

histogram.name: Linux.Wayland.BaseShellUsed
histogram.summary: The Linux Wayland base shell protocol used actually. Logged in each session when the browser creates the first shell surface.

histogram.name: Linux.Wayland.Shell
histogram.summary: The Linux Wayland shell protocol(s) available. Logged in each session when the compositor announces a Wayland protocol extension that provides the desktop shell functionality (i.e., turns abstract surfaces into windows that can be positioned, moved, resized, etc., depending on the particular shell).

histogram.name: Linux.WindowManager
histogram.summary: The window manager used. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.LcppStatCorruptedAtLearnTime
histogram.summary: The status of SetLCPPNavigationHint. It is recorded when the kLCPCriticalPathPredictor feature is enabled and MaybeSetLCPPNavigationHint is called. It includes status on not only SetLCPPNavigation failure, but also success for ease of understanding the failure ratio.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.OptimizationHintsReceiveStatus
histogram.summary: The status of when the optimization hints were received by the Loading Predictor. This will be recorded on navigations for which predictions from the Optimization Guide were received.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectCount
histogram.summary: The number of origins that were preconnected for a page load. It includes preconnect attempts that don't result in new opened connection. Logged after the preconnect manager completes all jobs attached to the page load.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectHitsPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of origins that were preconnected and requested by a page load to the total number of origins that were preconnected for a page load. Logged after the preconnect manager completes all jobs attached to the page load.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectLearningCount
histogram.summary: When the loading predictor has origins in the local database for a given navigation to preconnect and preresolve, the count of predicted origins.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectLearningPrecision
histogram.summary: When the loading predictor has origins in the local database for a given navigation to preconnect and preresolve, the precision of the predictions in percentage. This is computed as 100 \times \frac{correct predictions}{predictions}.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectLearningRecall
histogram.summary: When the loading predictor has origins in the local database for a given navigation to preconnect and preresolve, the recall of the predictions, in percentage. This is computed as 100 \times \frac{correct predictions}{all prefetchable subresources}.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectLearningRedirectStatus
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has origins in the local database for a given navigation to preconnect and preresolve, records stats about whether redirect was predicted correctly or incorrectly.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreresolveCount
histogram.summary: The number of hosts that were preresolved for a page load. It includes only successful DNS lookups. Logged after the preconnect manager completes all jobs attached to the page load.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreresolveHitsPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of hosts that were preresolved and requested by a page load to the total number of hosts that were preresolved for a page load. Logged after the preconnect manager completes all jobs attached to the page load.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.SetLcppNavigationHint.Status
histogram.summary: The status of SetLCPPNavigationHint. It is recorded when the kLCPCriticalPathPredictor feature is enabled and MaybeSetLCPPNavigationHint is called. It includes status on not only SetLCPPNavigation failure, but also success for ease of understanding the failure ratio.

histogram.name: LowPriorityIframes.IframeRequestPriority
histogram.summary: Original Blink priority of the request that belongs to an iframe. Recorded for every request fetched via Blink, but only when the experiment to lower the priority of iframes is enabled.

histogram.name: LowPriorityIframes.MainFrameRequestPriority
histogram.summary: Original Blink priority of the request that belongs to the main frame. Recorded for every request fetched via Blink, but only when the experiment to lower the priority of iframes is enabled.

histogram.name: Mac.FileMenuNativeShare
histogram.summary: Whether the user successfully shared via a native sharing extension after selecting it from the File > Share menu. False can indicate failure or user-initiated cancellation.

histogram.name: Mac.LaunchApplicationResult
histogram.summary: The result of calls to base::mac::LaunchApplication, logged once for every invocation of that method.

histogram.name: Mac.UniversalLink.APIDuration
histogram.summary: Native macOS apps can claim regions of the URL space for themselves, and so on every navigation, Chromium calls the SFUniversalLink API to determine if the URL being navigated to requires special handling. The SFUniversalLink API is usually instantaneous, but for some machines it's very slow. This metric logs the amount of time that it the SFUniversalLink API took to run, if over 100ms. This metric is logged once per run of Chrome, because if that API call ever takes longer than 100ms, it is disabled and never used again in that run of Chrome.

histogram.name: Manifest.HasProperty
histogram.summary: Tracks which properties of a Manifest were present when it was parsed. If a property can't be parsed, it will be recorded as not present. These histograms will only be used if the Manifest was correctly fetched and parsed and the parsed manifest is not empty.

histogram.name: Manifest.ParseIdResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of parsing id field in the Manifest.

histogram.name: Mist.SwitchResult
histogram.summary: The result (e.g. success or the type of failure) of a modem interface switch operation performed by mist on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.ErrorOrResponseCode
histogram.summary: The net error or HTTP response code of a mixed content resource request that was autoupgraded to HTTPS. This histogram was expired from M80 to M108.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Failure.IsAd
histogram.summary: Whether or not an autoupgrade mixed content request was for a resource we know to be an ad. This histogram was expired from M80 to M108.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Failure.Type
histogram.summary:
Logs the type of each resource request that is autoupgraded to HTTPS and fails to load. This histogram was expired from M80 to M108.
Warning: an unexpected reorder happened in Apr 2021 (https://crrev.com/c/2798954). Please do not trust older reports.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Response.Type
histogram.summary:
Logs the type of each resource request that was autoupgraded to HTTPS and resulted in a response. This histogram was expired from M80 to M108.
Warning: an unexpected reorder happened in Apr 2021 (https://crrev.com/c/2798954). Please do not trust older reports.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Start.Type
histogram.summary:
Logs the type of each resource request that is autoupgraded to HTTPS. This is logged when the request is started. This histogram was expired from M80 to M108.
Warning: an unexpected reorder happened in Apr 2021 (https://crrev.com/c/2798954). Please do not trust older reports.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Status
histogram.summary: The status of a mixed content resource request that was autoupgraded to HTTPS. This histogram was expired from M80 to M108.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.RelocationsUnordered
histogram.summary: Logged when the relocations in a module are not ordered causing the module verification to abort.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteMessageLatency
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken to fully write a channel message to the underlying channel.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteMessageSize
histogram.summary: The size of a message written to a channel.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteQueued
histogram.summary: Tracks whether or not a message is written directly to a channel or queued.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteQueuePendingMessages
histogram.summary: The number queued messages waiting to be written, measured when a channel flush is attempted.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteReceiveMessageProcessType
histogram.summary: Records the number of received Mojo IPCs, split per process. Emitted each time a mojo IPC is received.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteSendMessageProcessType
histogram.summary: Records the number of sent Mojo IPCs, split per process. Emitted each time a mojo IPC is sent.

histogram.name: Mojo.Connector.MaxUnreadMessageQuotaUsed
histogram.summary: The maximal unread message quota used for the lifetime of a Connector. This is sampled for a configurable percentage of Connectors only when the feature MojoRecordUnreadMessageCount is enabled. By default 1% of Connectors are sampled, as there's some overhead involved in enabling the unread message quota on a MessagePipe. See //mojo/public/cpp/bindings/lib/connector.cc.

histogram.name: Mojo.InvalidUTF8String
histogram.summary: Emitted any time a Mojo string is deserialized and is not valid UTF-8.

histogram.name: Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting changes by the user. This replaces the old Mouse.Sensitivity.Changed metric. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Started
histogram.summary:
Tracks mouse sensitivity setting on startup. This replaces the old Mouse.Sensitivity.Started metric. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Expired from 2022-12-04 to M113. May be missing some data.

histogram.name: Mouse.ScrollAcceleration
histogram.summary: Whether mouse scroll acceleration is enabled. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.ScrollSensitivity
histogram.summary:
Mouse scroll sensitivity value. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-12-01 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MPArch.ChildProcessLaunchFirst
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn the first child subprocess (including sandbox init).

histogram.name: MPArch.ChildProcessLaunchSubsequent
