histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn child sub processes not counting the first one.

histogram.name: MPArch.ForkTime
histogram.summary: Time to call fork() or clone(), in ms. Recorded at each fork excluding from the zygote, only on posix platforms.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_RepaintDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_TabSwitchPaintDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98. Replaced by Browser.Tabs.TotalSwitchDuration.*
histogram.summary: Time from tab switch requested to tab appearing on screen (Aura and Mac only).

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SwitchActiveUserUIPath
histogram.summary: Count the number of times each UI path is taken for switching the active account in a Chrome OS multiprofile session. UI paths include the system tray and the keyboard shortcut.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.UsersPerSessionIncremental
histogram.summary: The number of users simultaneously signed into a multiprofile session on Chrome OS. This is recorded whenever a user gets added to the session. To get the correct count, all following counts must be subtracted. Example: If 100 single user, 20 two user and 5 three user sessions, there were 100-20-5=75 single user sessions, 100-80=20 dual user sessions and so on. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-04-10 till 2023-07-10.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.AuthenticationMethod
histogram.summary: The method used to authenticate to a share. This is called on each attempted mount.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.GetSharesResult
histogram.summary: The result of the GetShares operation for Native SMB File Share. This is recorded after the D-Bus call to GetShares returns.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.MountCount
histogram.summary: The number of active mounts that a user has. This is recorded after a share has been successfully mounted.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.MountResult
histogram.summary: The result of the mount operation for Native SMB File Share. This is recorded after the D-Bus call to Mount returns.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.ReadDirectoryCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M87. No longer used with smbfs.
histogram.summary: The number of entries read when calling ReadDirectory. This is recorded after the D-Bus call to ReadDirectory returns.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.ReadDirectoryDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M87. No longer used with smbfs.
histogram.summary: The duration of ReadDirectory call to SmbProvider in milliseconds. This is recorded after the D-Bus call returns.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.RemountResult
histogram.summary: The result of the Remount operation during startup. This is recorded after the D-Bus call to Remount returns.

histogram.name: NCN.NetworkOperatorMCCMNC
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 10/2021 because the location permission protected API is required to get this information and this isn't a must-have histogram.
histogram.summary: The MCC (mobile country code) and MNC (mobile network code) of the network operator when a new metrics log is created or when the network connection is changed. A value of zero means a non-mobile network or the operator code is unknown.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.ReadCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the network quality prefs were read by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.ReadSize
histogram.summary: Count of the number of network IDs in the prefs read by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.WriteCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the network quality prefs were written by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.ObservationSource
histogram.summary: Number of RTT observations indexed by the source of the observation. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time a new observation is made or synthesized.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of the round trip time at the URLRequest layer. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestore
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie session restore process.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestoreTimeToFailure
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the session restore to fail.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestoreTimeToSuccess
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the session restore to finish successfully.

histogram.name: OccludedWindowMouseEvents
histogram.summary: Incremented each time a mouse event is handled by a window that is marked as occluded. This number should be 0 or very close to 0. It should be much less than the number of times a window is mark occluded - WindowOcclusionChanged.Occluded.

histogram.name: OffscreenCanvas.TextMetrics.SetFont
histogram.obsolete: Retired in M93, replaced by OffscreenCanvas.TextMetrics.SetFont2 which has a wider range.
histogram.summary:
Time spent in microseconds to perform call SetFont in canvas for OffscreenCanvas. It's measured each time SetFont is called.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: OffscreenCanvas.TextMetrics.SetFont2
histogram.summary:
Time spent in microseconds to perform call SetFont in canvas for OffscreenCanvas. It's measured each time SetFont is called.
This differs from OffscreenCanvas.TextMetrics.SetFont in that it uses buckets up to ten seconds rather than ten milliseconds (due to a change in the underlying histogramming function called).
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.CriticalRestart
histogram.summary:
Reports whether the presence of a Critical-Origin-Trial header caused a network request restart due to the origin trial not being enabled.
The Critical-Origin-Trial header is only processed for navigation requests (loading either a main- or sub-frame) using a safe HTTP verb (per section 4.2.1 of RFC 7231). On those requests, this metric will be emitted if the Critical-Origin-Trial header is present on the response, to report the decision made by the CriticalOriginTrialThrottle.
The request may still be restarted due to other throttles, even if this metric reported "false".

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.LevelDbInitSuccess
histogram.summary: Reports status of LevelDB initialization for persistent origin trials. This is emitted on the Init callback during browser startup, and should not be false. A high rate of "false" would indicate a problem with the shared LevelDB database.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.LevelDbLoadSize
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of origins in the LevelDb database at time of load during browser startup.
This metric is for reporting only, and expected to get worse if you are in the process of launching a persistent origin trial.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.LevelDbLoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Reports status of LevelDB load for persistent origin trials. This is emitted on the Load callback during browser startup, and should not be false. A high rate of "false" would indicate a problem with the shared LevelDB database.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.LevelDbLoadTime
histogram.summary:
Measures the time to load the data from LevelDb during startup in wall clock time.
This metric is for reporting only, and expected to get worse if you are in the process of launching a persistent origin trial.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.OriginLookupsBeforeDbLoad
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of lookups for origins arriving to the LevelDbPersistenceProvider before the database was loaded from disk. Any such lookup would not have seen the persisted value.
Since the database is loaded asynchronously, it is possible for the browser to start using the PersistentOriginTrial component before it is fully loaded. Due to this, it is expected to see this metric at 1, possibly 2. Large numbers can be caused by a browser restart with a lot of saved tabs being loaded at the same time.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.OriginsAddedBeforeDbLoad
histogram.summary: Counts the number of origins added to the LevelDbPersistenceProvider before the persited origins have loaded from disk. This number represents the number of page loads for pages enrolled in persistent origin trials where the trial was either not activated or the request had to restart due to the presence of the Persistent-Origin-Trial header.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.PartitionSetSize
histogram.summary: Reports the number of partitions a persistent origin trial token has been stored against. The purpose of the metric is to uncover memory footprint issues from storing site partitions, and to help decide if an eviction strategy needs to be put in place. This metric is recorded once for every stored origin trial token on browser startup.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.PersistentOriginTrial.TokenHasFirstPartyPartition
histogram.summary: Records whether a stored partition token has its own origins eTLD+1 as one of the partitions. This is being recorded to determine if space can be saved by making the first-party partition a special case. This metric is recorded on browser startup when the persisted tokens are loaded from the database.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.ValidationResult
histogram.summary: Counts the results of token validation checks to enable experimental features. The result for each token validation check is counted once per token per execution context (e.g. page, worker).

histogram.name: OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.Decrypt.ResultCode
histogram.summary: The result code of the application-bound Decrypt operation. This is logged once during browser startup on a background thread for system-level installs on Windows only.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.Decrypt.ResultLastError
histogram.summary: The GetLastError code for a failed application-bound Decrypt operation. This is logged once during browser startup on a background thread for system-level installs on Windows only, if the call to Decrypt failed.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.Decrypt.Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time, in ms, that it takes to perform an application-bound Decrypt call. This is logged once during browser startup on a background thread for system-level installs on Windows only.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.Encrypt.ResultCode
histogram.summary: The result code of the application-bound Encrypt operation. This is logged once during browser startup on a background thread for system-level installs on Windows only, for a client that is initializing a new local state or a previously failing client.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.Encrypt.ResultLastError
histogram.summary: The GetLastError code for a failed application-bound Encrypt operation. This is logged once during browser startup on a background thread for system-level installs on Windows only, if the call to Encrypt failed, for a client that is initializing a new local state or a previously failing client.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.Encrypt.Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time, in ms, that it takes to perform an application-bound Encrypt call. This is logged once during browser startup on a background thread for system-level installs on Windows only, for a client that is initializing a new local state or a previously failing client.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.BackendUsage
histogram.summary: The backend selected for this user and whether it was initialised successfully.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.Linux.DecryptedWithEmptyKey
histogram.summary: True, iff the data was not decryptable with the stored encryption key, but was decryptable with a key generated from an empty string. This is emitted every time OSCrypt attempts to decrypt a value.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.Win.Decrypt.Result
histogram.summary: Whether or not the DPAPI Decrypt call to decrypt the OSCrypt key succeeeded. This is logged once during browser startup on Windows.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.Win.Decrypt.Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time, in ms, that it takes to perform a DPAPI Decrypt call. This is logged once during browser startup on Windows.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.Win.Encrypt.Result
histogram.summary: Whether or not the DPAPI Encrypt call to encrypt the OSCrypt key succeeeded. This is logged once during browser startup on Windows, if there is no stored key and a new one has to be generated. This data will therefore be biased towards newer clients. See OSCrypt.Win.Decrypt.Result which contains unbiased data.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.Win.Encrypt.Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time, in ms, that it takes to perform a DPAPI Encrypt call. This is logged once during browser startup on Windows, if there is no stored key and a new one has to be generated. This data will therefore be biased towards newer clients. See OSCrypt.Win.Decrypt.Time which contains unbiased data.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.Win.KeyDecryptionError
histogram.summary: The Windows GetLastError after a failure from calling into DPAPI to decrypt the master key for the os_crypt library on Windows. This is recorded during the OSCrypt::Init each time the decryption fails.

histogram.name: OSX.ExceptionHandlerEvents
histogram.summary: Events seen by the OSX NSException swizzle.

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.Source
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. It indicates if the fullscreen is triggered for the browser or the tab content.

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.Style
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. It indicates the mechanism (immersive vs. AppKit) and the type of AppKit Fullscreen (Presentation Mode vs. Canonical Fullscreen).

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.WindowLocation
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. It indicates the screen in which the window was fullscreened, and the number of screens available.

histogram.name: OSX.Handoff.Origin
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a Handoff is received by Chrome on OSX. The enumeration indicates the source of the Handoff.

histogram.name: OSX.Installation.OtherChromeInstances
histogram.summary: The instances of other copies of Google Chrome on the user's Mac. Logged once on startup, and only for Chrome Beta and Chrome Dev. Will be used to determine if/how home directory migration will be done for side-by-side.

histogram.name: OSX.NativeShare
histogram.summary: Whether the user successfully shared via a native sharing extension after selecting it from the File > Share menu. False can indicate failure or user-initiated cancellation. This is obsolete; the same data is currently being collected as Mac.FileMenuNativeShare.

histogram.name: OSX.Settings.ScreensHaveSeparateSpaces
histogram.summary: The configuration of the setting "Screens Have Separate Spaces" available in OSX 10.9+.

histogram.name: OSX.SystemHotkeyMap.LoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to load the system hotkeys on a Mac was successful.

histogram.name: Ozone.NeuralStylusReport.ActivePalmTouchCount
histogram.summary: When a stylus is touched to screen, the number of palms on the device at that time.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.HoldCountAtCancel
histogram.summary: The count of the number of held events cancelled when we decide to finally cancel a stroke. Only reported if events have been held, and will be positive. Events are only held from PalmDetectionFilter.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.HoldCountAtRelease
histogram.summary: The count of the number of held events released at once for a stroke when we decide to release. Only reported if events have been held, and will be positive. Events are only held from PalmDetectionFilter.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.PalmTouchCount
histogram.summary: The count of the number of detected palm touches. Reported when a new palm touch is detected by either the firmware or the software palm detection. Consecutive palm touch events will be considered as the same palm touch.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.RepeatedTouchCount
histogram.summary: Whether a repeated touch is detected soon after palm rejection. Reported when users repeated a touch action within 2 seconds after we rejected the first action as palm. This only emits true when we detect a repeated touch but never emits false.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.StylusSessionCount
histogram.summary: The count of the number of stylus sessions. A stylus session is a series of stylus events with no more than 5 seconds between them. Reported when a stylus session is concluded.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.StylusSessionLength
histogram.summary: The length of stylus sessions. A stylus session is a series of stylus events with no more than 5 seconds between them. Reported when a stylus session is concluded.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.TouchGapAfterStylus
histogram.summary: The time between a stylus touch and the first finger touch after it. The finger touch may or may not be detected as a palm. If the first touch after a stylus touch is another stylus touch (i.e. no finger touch between them), record a maximum time (10 seconds) instead. Reported when first new touch is reported after a stylus touch finishes.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.TouchGapBeforeStylus
histogram.summary: The time between a stylus touch and the last finger touch before it. The finger touch may or may not still be on the touchscreen, and may or may not be detected as a palm. Reported when a stylus touch is started on the touchscreen.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.TouchSessionCount
histogram.summary: The count of the number of touch sessions. A touch session is a series of touch events with no more than 5 seconds between them. Reported when a touch session is concluded.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.TouchSessionLength
histogram.summary: The length of touch sessions. A touch session is a series of touch events with no more than 5 seconds between them. Reported when a touch session is concluded.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.TouchTypeAfterStylus
histogram.summary: The type of the first finger touch within 500ms before a stylus touch. It could be finger, palm or none (no touch within 500ms). Reported when a stylus touch is started on the touchscreen.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchEventConverterEvdev.TouchTypeBeforeStylus
histogram.summary: The type of the last finger touch within 500ms before a stylus touch. It could be finger, palm or none (no touch within 500ms). Reported when first new touch is reported after a stylus touch finishes.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.ClientCount
histogram.summary: The number of currently connected HTTP clients. This is reported every time a HTTP client connects.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.ContentServedInterruptedMB
histogram.summary: Number of megabytes (1,000,000 bytes) served from the device (via HTTP) where the client disconnects prematurely. This is reported every time a file is served and the client disconnects before receiving all data.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.FileCount
histogram.summary: The number of files available via p2p. This is reported every time a file is added or removed to the /var/cache/p2p directory.

histogram.name: PageImageService.Backend.OptimizationGuide.Result{ClientId}
histogram.summary:
Records the result of requests to the Optimization Guide Salient Images backend.
Recorded for each request to Optimization Guide, so the total count of this UMA should match that bucket count in PageImageService.Backend.

histogram.name: PageImageService.Backend.Suggest.Result{ClientId}
histogram.summary:
Records the result of requests to the Suggest backend.
Recorded for each request to Suggest, so the total count of this UMA should match that bucket count in PageImageService.Backend.

histogram.name: PageImageService.Backend{ClientId}
histogram.summary:
Records the backend chosen for the request. For requests with no valid backend, this is still recorded as the "No Valid Backend" bucket.
Only recorded for requests that have passed the URL consent gate.

histogram.name: PageImageService.ConsentStatusOnTimeout
histogram.summary: Records the result of the URL consent check after timeout has expired. Recorded for each request which was enqueued by the time when timeout happened.

histogram.name: PageImageService.ConsentStatusRequestCount
histogram.summary: Recorded on each URL consent check request. This metric is used to compare numbers with consent check result in PageImageService.ConsentStatus.

histogram.name: PageImageService.ConsentStatus{ClientId}
histogram.summary:
Records the result of the URL consent check for this request. The number of consent check requests is recorded in PageImageService.ConsentStatusRequestCount.
Note that only success and failure are captured if the "old" unified consent throttle is used.

histogram.name: PageImageService.ConsentTimeoutReason{ClientId}
histogram.summary: Records the reason of the URL consent check timeout ({ClientId}). Recorded for each request which was enqueued by the time when timeout happened.

histogram.name: PaintHolding.CommitTrigger2
histogram.summary: Records the reason that a commit was triggered, to enable research into which event (non-same-origin, FCP, timeout, etc) led to the first commit.

histogram.name: PaintHolding.InputTiming4
histogram.summary: Records whether or not input arrived before the first paint.

histogram.name: PartnerBookmark.LoadingTime
histogram.summary: The time spent on loading partner bookmarks, from kickOffReading() to bookmarkModelLoaded() callback.

histogram.name: PendingBeaconHost.Action
histogram.summary:
Warning: this histogram was expired from M113 to M115; data may be missing.
The type of PendingBeacon-related action that the browser has performed.
This is only recorded when the PendingBeacon API is called to create, send, or cancel a beacon. See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/experiments/pending-beacon.md and https://crrev.com/c/4028260 for more details.

histogram.name: PendingBeaconHost.BatchAction
histogram.summary:
Warning: this histogram was expired from M113 to M115; data may be missing.
The type of batch PendingBeacon-related action that the browser has performed. A batch action means the browser is about to batch process all queued pending beacon requests at once.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/experiments/pending-beacon.md and https://crrev.com/c/4028260 for more details.

histogram.name: Pepper.Graphics3DHasShareGroup
histogram.summary: True if a non-flash Pepper Graphics3D context has a share group.

histogram.name: Pepper.InterfaceUsed
histogram.summary: The number of out-of-process plugin processes that have loaded a particular PPB interface version.

histogram.name: Pepper.PluginContextSecurity.TCPConnect
histogram.summary: Whether a Pepper TCP connect attempt comes from a plugin in a secure or an insecure origin.

histogram.name: Pepper.PluginContextSecurity.UDPBind
histogram.summary: Whether a Pepper UDP bind attempt comes from a plugin in a secure or an insecure origin.

histogram.name: PeriodicBackgroundSync.Event.BatchSize
histogram.summary: Records the number of `periodicsync` events which were fired in a batch. A batch is defined as the set of `periodicsync` events dispatched at the same time by the BackgroundSyncManager. Periodic syncs usually run in a batch.

histogram.name: PeriodicBackgroundSync.Event.FromWakeupTask
histogram.summary: Records whether the fired `periodicsync` events upon completion orginated from a background wakeup task or the foreground.

histogram.name: PeriodicBackgroundSync.Event.Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to execute a batch of periodicsync events. A batch is defined as the set of `periodicsync` events dispatched at the same time by the BackgroundSyncManager. Periodic syncs often run in a batch.

histogram.name: PLT.iOS.BrowserInitiatedPageLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by PLT.iOS.BrowserInitiatedPageLoadTime2 as of M92, in order to use more granular buckets above 10 seconds.
histogram.summary:
Page load time for Browser-initiated navigations.
Browser-initiated navigations include all navigations initiated by interacting with Chrome's UI elements, except for back/forward navigations. Specifically, typing a URL into the omnibox, tapping the reload button, loading a bookmark, and loading a page from the reading list (including when offline) are all considered browser-initiated. Additionally, background loads for prerendering and reading-list offline sync are also browser-initiated, as is a reload triggered by switching to a tab whose WKWebView renderer process was killed by the OS.
This is recorded for successful main-frame navigations (that is, navigations that don't result in the browser displaying an error page). The recorded value measures the time from the navigation request being sent to the renderer process until all frames have fired their load events. For background loads, the same interval is measured while the page loads and fires load events in the background; the metric is not recorded again if the background-loaed page is later displayed in the foreground.
Page loads that require network fetches will be slower than those where all necessary resources are already present in WebKit's HTTP cache. Reload navigations where all cached resources are up-to-date are particularly fast, since they don't require any rendering updates either.
It is possible for a user to interact with a page before all load events have been fired, so the recorded value should not be interpreted as the time before the page becomes interactive.
Most things that affect user-perceived page load time on iOS are within WebKit, not within Chromium/Chrome code. To assess whether a change in this metric is caused by a WebKit change, split by OS version. WebKit changes always come with an OS version change. Obviously, aside from WebKit and Chromium changes, this metric can move due to exogenous factors such as changes in what type of web page people are looking at or changes in the implementation of popular websites.
Any navigation that is not considered browser-initiated is considered to be renderer-initiated (see PLT.iOS.RendererInitiatedPageLoadTime).

histogram.name: PLT.iOS.BrowserInitiatedPageLoadTime2
histogram.summary:
Page load time for Browser-initiated navigations.
Browser-initiated navigations include all navigations initiated by interacting with Chrome's UI elements, except for back/forward navigations. Specifically, typing a URL into the omnibox, tapping the reload button, loading a bookmark, and loading a page from the reading list (including when offline) are all considered browser-initiated. Additionally, background loads for prerendering and reading-list offline sync are also browser-initiated, as is a reload triggered by switching to a tab whose WKWebView renderer process was killed by the OS.
This is recorded for successful main-frame navigations (that is, navigations that don't result in the browser displaying an error page). The recorded value measures the time from the navigation request being sent to the renderer process until all frames have fired their load events. For background loads, the same interval is measured while the page loads and fires load events in the background; the metric is not recorded again if the background-loaed page is later displayed in the foreground.
Page loads that require network fetches will be slower than those where all necessary resources are already present in WebKit's HTTP cache. Reload navigations where all cached resources are up-to-date are particularly fast, since they don't require any rendering updates either.
It is possible for a user to interact with a page before all load events have been fired, so the recorded value should not be interpreted as the time before the page becomes interactive.
Most things that affect user-perceived page load time on iOS are within WebKit, not within Chromium/Chrome code. To assess whether a change in this metric is caused by a WebKit change, split by OS version. WebKit changes always come with an OS version change. Obviously, aside from WebKit and Chromium changes, this metric can move due to exogenous factors such as changes in what type of web page people are looking at or changes in the implementation of popular websites.
Any navigation that is not considered browser-initiated is considered to be renderer-initiated (see PLT.iOS.RendererInitiatedPageLoadTime2).

histogram.name: PLT.iOS.RendererInitiatedPageLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by PLT.iOS.RendererInitiatedPageLoadTime2 as of M92, in order to use more granular buckets above 10 seconds.
histogram.summary:
Page load time for Renderer-initiated navigations.
Renderer-initiated navigations are all main-frame navigations that are not considered to be browser-initiated (see PLT.iOS.BrowserInitiatedPageLoadTime). Specificially, tapping on links within web content, navigations triggered by JavaScript, navigations for restoring tabs on launch, and back/forward navigations are all considered to be renderer-initiated.
This is recorded for successful main-frame navigations (that is, navigations that don't result in the browser displaying an error page). However, this is not recorded when WebKit handles a back/forward navigation using its page cache (that is, when the DOM representation of the destination is still loaded in memory from a recent visit), since we don't get the full set of WebKit navigation callbacks for such navigations. The recorded value measures the time from the browser process being notified that the navigation has started, to all frames having fired their load events. The time that the browser process is notified that the navigation has started is usually just after a network request is sent, but can be later for back/forward navigations on sites that use pushState to generate history entries; in the latter case, the navigation may be almost finished by the time the browser finds out about it. As such, depending on the cause of the navigation, different things are measured. Some types will be very fast (e.g., pushState/replaceState) and others (such as tapping on links) will be slower. Furthermore, navigations that require network fetches will be slower than those where all necessary resources are already present in WebKit's HTTP cache.
It is possible for a user to interact with a page before all load events have been fired, so the recorded value should not be interpreted as the time before the page becomes interactive.
Most things that affect user-perceived page load time on iOS are within WebKit, not within Chromium/Chrome code. To assess whether a change in this metric is caused by a WebKit change, split by OS version. WebKit changes always come with an OS version change. Obviously, aside from WebKit and Chromium changes, this metric can move due to exogenous factors such as changes in what type of web page people are looking at or changes in the implementation of popular websites.

histogram.name: PLT.iOS.RendererInitiatedPageLoadTime2
histogram.summary:
Page load time for Renderer-initiated navigations.
Renderer-initiated navigations are all main-frame navigations that are not considered to be browser-initiated (see PLT.iOS.BrowserInitiatedPageLoadTime). Specificially, tapping on links within web content, navigations triggered by JavaScript, navigations for restoring tabs on launch, and back/forward navigations are all considered to be renderer-initiated.
This is recorded for successful main-frame navigations (that is, navigations that don't result in the browser displaying an error page). However, this is not recorded when WebKit handles a back/forward navigation using its page cache (that is, when the DOM representation of the destination is still loaded in memory from a recent visit), since we don't get the full set of WebKit navigation callbacks for such navigations. The recorded value measures the time from the browser process being notified that the navigation has started, to all frames having fired their load events. The time that the browser process is notified that the navigation has started is usually just after a network request is sent, but can be later for back/forward navigations on sites that use pushState to generate history entries; in the latter case, the navigation may be almost finished by the time the browser finds out about it. As such, depending on the cause of the navigation, different things are measured. Some types will be very fast (e.g., pushState/replaceState) and others (such as tapping on links) will be slower. Furthermore, navigations that require network fetches will be slower than those where all necessary resources are already present in WebKit's HTTP cache.
It is possible for a user to interact with a page before all load events have been fired, so the recorded value should not be interpreted as the time before the page becomes interactive.
Most things that affect user-perceived page load time on iOS are within WebKit, not within Chromium/Chrome code. To assess whether a change in this metric is caused by a WebKit change, split by OS version. WebKit changes always come with an OS version change. Obviously, aside from WebKit and Chromium changes, this metric can move due to exogenous factors such as changes in what type of web page people are looking at or changes in the implementation of popular websites.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToStart. Start: requestStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToCommit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToCommit. Start: requestStart. Commit: responseStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToFinish. Start: requestStart. Finish: loadEventEnd.

histogram.name: PLT.RequestToStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "start." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document.

histogram.name: PointingStick.Acceleration
histogram.summary:
Acceleration setting for pointing sticks (typically TrackPoints, the miniature red joysticks found in some laptop keyboards). Only reported on Chrome OS.
Expired from 2021-04-01 to M113. May be missing some data.

histogram.name: PointingStick.PointerSensitivity
histogram.summary:
Sensitivity value for pointing sticks (typically TrackPoints, the miniature red joysticks found in some laptop keyboards). Only reported on Chrome OS.
Expired from 2021-04-01 to M113. May be missing some data.

histogram.name: PointingStick.PrimaryButtonRight
histogram.summary:
Setting for the primary button of pointing sticks (typically TrackPoints, the miniature red joysticks found in some laptop keyboards). Only reported on Chrome OS.
Expired from 2021-04-01 to M113. May be missing some data.

histogram.name: PrefetchedSignedExchangeCache.BodySize
histogram.summary: The body size of each prefetched signed exchanges in PrefetchedSignedExchangeCache which is attached to a frame. Recorded when the frame is deleted or is navigated to different document.

histogram.name: PrefetchedSignedExchangeCache.BodySizeTotal
histogram.summary: The total body size of prefetched signed exchanges in PrefetchedSignedExchangeCache which is attached to a frame. This metric is recorded when the frame is deleted or is navigated to different document. This is not recorded when there is no prefetched signed exchanges.

histogram.name: PrefetchedSignedExchangeCache.Count
histogram.summary: The number of prefetched signed exchanges in PrefetchedSignedExchangeCache which is attached to a frame. This metric is recorded when the frame is deleted or is navigated to different document. This is not recorded when there is no prefetched signed exchanges.

histogram.name: PrefetchedSignedExchangeCache.HeadersSizeTotal
histogram.summary: The total headers size of prefetched signed exchanges including outer response headers and inner response headers in PrefetchedSignedExchangeCache which is attached to a frame. This metric is recorded when the frame is deleted or is navigated to different document. This is not recorded when there is no prefetched signed exchanges.

histogram.name: PrefService.ReadError
histogram.summary: Enumeration of errors that happened when reading Preferences files.

histogram.name: Previews.CacheControlNoTransform.BlockedPreview
histogram.summary: Blocked previews due to Cache-Control:no-transform directive.

histogram.name: Previews.ContentLength
histogram.obsolete: Not even logged by code. Obsolete in 09/2020.
histogram.summary: The actual data used for a page load using a preview optimization.

histogram.name: Previews.DataInflation
histogram.obsolete: Not even logged by code. Obsolete in 09/2020.
histogram.summary: The estimated amount that the content was inflated for a page load using a previews optimization. Recorded when a page load using a previews optimization inflates the data used.

histogram.name: Previews.DataInflationPercent
histogram.obsolete: Not even logged by code. Obsolete in 09/2020.
histogram.summary: The estimated percent of data used that a page load would have otherwise cost for a page load using a previews optimization. Recorded when a page load using a previews optimization inflates the data used.

histogram.name: Previews.DataSavings
histogram.summary: The estimated data savings for a page load using a previews optimization. Recorded when a page load using a previews optimization reduces the data used.

histogram.name: Previews.DataSavingsPercent
histogram.summary: The estimated percent of data savings for a page load using a previews optimization. Recorded when a page load using a previews optimization reduces the data used.

histogram.name: Previews.DeferAllScript.DenyListMatch
histogram.summary: Records true when a URL matches the regex of denylist. Recorded at the time of navigation commit.

histogram.name: Previews.DeferAllScript.RedirectLoopDetectedUsingCache
histogram.summary: Records true when a redirect loop is detected when defer all script is in use. Recorded at the time of navigation commit.

histogram.name: Previews.EligibilityReason
histogram.summary: When evaluating whether to show a user a preview, the preview might be disallowed for various reasons. If the preview is disallowed, then this reports the reason for disallowing it. If the preview is allowed, then this generally reports "Previews Allowed". It may instead report "Previews Allowed without server rule check" for a preview that expects to check server rules but they are not enabled. Recorded throughout navigation at the beginning of each navigation, after each redirect, and during commit.

histogram.name: Previews.LitePageNotificationInfoBar
histogram.summary: User interactions with the HTTPS Server Previews notification InfoBar.

histogram.name: Previews.OmniboxAction
histogram.summary: User interactions with the Previews Android Omnibox UI.

histogram.name: Previews.OptOut.UserOptedOut
histogram.summary: Whether the user chose to reload the original page when shown a preview.

histogram.name: Previews.OriginalContentLength
histogram.obsolete: Not even logged by code. Obsolete in 09/2020.
histogram.summary: The estimated content length of a page load using a preview optimization.

histogram.name: Previews.PageEndReason
histogram.summary: Records why the page load ended on a given preview type.

histogram.name: Previews.Triggered.EffectiveConnectionType2
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type of a navigation that triggers a preview. This is captured at commit time but uses the effective connection type from the beginning of the navigation.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.Launch.Error
histogram.summary: Errors returned while launching sandboxed process on Windows. For decoding error code please refer to http://goo.gl/fJJiAv.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.Lowbox.Launch.Error
histogram.summary:
Errors returned while launching lowbox enabled sandboxed process on Windows. For decoding error code please refer to http://goo.gl/fJJiAv.
Warning: this histogram expired in M87, and was revived in M103; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.StartSandboxedWin.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of StartSandboxedProcess() including the time Windows spends starting the suspended process. Emitted on a successful launch of a sandboxed process on Windows. Only emitted where a high-resolution timer is available (see Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks).

histogram.name: ProxyOverriddenBubble.UserSelection
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when the "proxy overridden" extension warning bubble is shown. Logged immediately after the action is taken.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.DeliveryStatus
histogram.summary: When a Service Worker receives a push message, this records whether the overall operation was successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.GetRegistrationStatus
histogram.summary:
When a webpage asks for details about its current push messaging registration, this records whether the request is successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.
This histogram was expired between 2022-06-26 and 2023-08-04.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.PushSubscriptionChangeStatus
histogram.summary: When a Service Worker receives a pushsubscriptionchange event, this records whether the overall operation was successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.RegistrationStatus
histogram.summary:
When a webpage registers for push messaging, this records whether the request is successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.
This histogram was expired between 2022-06-26 and 2023-08-04.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.TimeToReadPersistedMessages
histogram.summary: When a message arrives for a lazy subscription and Chrome isn't in the foreground, it is persisted on disk until next time Chrome is in the foreground. This histogram measures the time spent in reading and replaying persisted messages when Chrome goes to the foreground.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.UnregistrationReason
histogram.summary: When unregistering a website from push messaging, this records the reason why it is being unregistered.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.UnregistrationStatus
histogram.summary:
When unregistering a website from push messaging, this records whether the request is successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.
This histogram was expired between 2022-06-26 and 2023-08-04.

histogram.name: ReadingList.AddOrReplaceEntry
histogram.summary: When an entry is added or replaced in the reading list, records in which storage this happened.

histogram.name: ReadingList.BookmarkBarState.On{Frequency}AddToReadingList
histogram.summary: The state of the bookmark bar recorded {Frequency} a user adds to the reading list. (Desktop only).

histogram.name: ReadingList.ContextMenu
histogram.summary: The action chosen by the user after displaying the reading list context menu.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Download.Failures
histogram.summary: Number of tries before the download of the entry is successful.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Download.Status
histogram.summary: Final status of the download of a reading list entry.

histogram.name: ReadingList.FirstReadAgeOnDeletion
histogram.summary: Time since the first read of the reading list entry getting deleted. 0 if it has never been read.

histogram.name: ReadingList.MarkEntryRead
histogram.summary: When a reading list entry is marked as read, records in which storage this happened.

histogram.name: ReadingList.OfflineVersionDisplayed
histogram.summary: Whether the displayed version is the offline one.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Read.AgeOnDeletion
histogram.summary: Time since the creation of the read reading list entry getting deleted.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Read.AgeOnFirstRead
histogram.summary: Time since the creation of the read reading list entry being read for the first time.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Read.Number
histogram.summary: Number of read entries in reading list.

histogram.name: ReadingList.SyncStateMatchesBookmarks
histogram.summary: Records whether the reading list and bookmarks sync states match on startup when not in Incognito or guest mode (Desktop only).

histogram.name: ReadingList.Unread.AgeOnDeletion
histogram.summary: Time since the creation of the unread reading list entry getting deleted.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Unread.Number
histogram.summary: Number of unread entries in reading list.

histogram.name: ReadingList.WebUI.InitialEntriesRenderTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to load the Read Later WebUI and render (at least) the initial list of entries. This is roughly equivalent to 'time to first meaningful paint' for the Read Later UI.

histogram.name: ReadingList.WebUI.LoadCompletedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the RenderFrameHost StartProvisionalLoad event and the RenderFrameHost DocumentOnLoadCompleted event for the Read Later WebUI page.

histogram.name: ReadingList.WebUI.LoadDocumentTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the RenderFrameHost StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the Read Later WebUI page.

histogram.name: ReadingList.WebUI.ReadingListDataReceived
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2021/02. Metric is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The time taken for the WebUI in the renderer to receive the full list of entries for the current user profile. This is measured as the time from when the data was first requested by the WebUI to when the data was received by the WebUI.

histogram.name: ReadingList.WindowDisplayedDuration
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time between when a reading list bubble is opened and when it is closed. It does so by recording the difference in time between when the the hosting WebUIBubbleDialogView's Widget is first created and when the widget is destroyed. This is logged on Desktop only.

histogram.name: ReadingList.{ReadStatus}.Count.{RecordedAt}.{StorageState}
histogram.summary: The number of {ReadStatus} items in the reading list {StorageState}. Recorded {RecordedAt}.

variant.name: OnModelLoaded
variant.summary: when the reading list model is loaded

variant.name: LocalStorageSyncing
variant.summary: in local storage which is being synced

histogram.name: RecoveryComponent.Event
histogram.summary: Log each stage of a recovery component event.

histogram.name: RecurrenceRanker.InitializationStatus
histogram.summary: Records situations that can occur during the configuration and initialization of a RecurrenceRanker.

histogram.name: RecurrenceRanker.JsonConfigConversionStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the conversion of a JSON config for a RecurrenceRanker succeeded for failed.

histogram.name: RecurrenceRanker.SerializationStatus
histogram.summary: Reports the result of a save or load of a RecurrenceRanker model.

histogram.name: RecurrenceRanker.Usage
histogram.summary: Reports when the functions of a RecurrenceRanker model are used.

histogram.name: ReduceAcceptLanguage.AcceptLanguageNegotiationRestart
histogram.summary: Count of requests restarted or the reason why not restarted when reducing accept-language HTTP header.

histogram.name: ReduceAcceptLanguage.ClearLatency
histogram.summary: The latency (in milliseconds) to clear the reduce accept language for a given origin in the language negotiation cache. This histogram is recorded when clearing persisted value from PrefService.

histogram.name: ReduceAcceptLanguage.FetchLatencyUs
histogram.summary:
The latency (in microseconds) to fetch the reduce accept language for a given origin in the language negotiation cache. This histogram is recorded when fetching persisted value from PrefService.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: ReduceAcceptLanguage.StoreLatency
histogram.summary: The latency (in milliseconds) to store the reduced accept language header value for a given origin in the language negotiation cache. This histogram is recorded when navigation responses are being processed.

histogram.name: ReduceAcceptLanguage.UpdateSize
histogram.summary: Count of reduce accept language that need to be persisted to the disk. Recorded by the renderer. This histogram is recorded when navigation responses are being processed.

histogram.name: RelaunchNotification.ShowResult
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to show a relaunch notification dialog.

histogram.name: RenderFrameHostImpl.DroppedInterfaceRequests
histogram.summary:
For each load in a frame, records the number of interface requests to RenderFrame::GetRemoteInterfaces that arrived to the RenderFrameHostImpl after the RFHI had already committed the next cross-document navigation.
This means that |document_scoped_interface_provider_binding_| was already unbound at the time from the interface connection that had been used to service RenderFrame::GetRemoteInterface for the previous load, so those interface requests are dropped. This histogram measures how often, if at all, that happens in practice.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.GetFallbackFontsTime
histogram.summary: Time retrieve the fallback fonts on the system used for RenderTextHarfBuzz::ShapeRuns. This metric is known to be quite slow on bad cases.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.GetFallbackFontTime
histogram.summary: Time retrieve the preferred fallback font on the system used for RenderTextHarfBuzz::ShapeRuns. Fallback font is determined based on the input text and locale.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.ShapeRunsFallback
histogram.summary: This metric records the fallback font mechanism required to complete the shaping of a text.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.ShapeRunsWithFallbackFontsTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform RenderTextHarfBuzz::ShapeRuns with retrieved the fallback fonts. This metric is known to be quite slow on bad cases.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.OpenLinkAsProfile
histogram.summary: Count the clicks and displays of renderer view context menu item Open Link as Profile, as well as Open Link in Incognito Window for comparison. If Open Link as Profile is a submenu, it is counted as displayed even if the submenu is not open, and only counted one time regardless the amount of items in the submenu.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.Shown
histogram.summary: Count of renderer view context menu items shown.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.Used
histogram.summary:
Count of renderer view context menu items (Only commands now) used.
The user action RenderViewContextMenu.Used.IDC_CONTENT_CONTEXT_SEARCHWEBFOR is also logged in case that IDC_CONTENT_CONTEXT_SEARCHWEBFOR is logged to this histogram.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: ReportingAndNEL.ErrorInitializeDB
histogram.summary: The exact database error encountered when initializing the Reporting and NEL database, if initialization fails catastrophically. This is recorded if the database initialization fails catastrophically when the DB initialization attempt is made, which typically occurs upon the first network request after startup. Catastrophic errors are defined in sql::IsErrorCatastrophic.

histogram.name: ReportingAndNEL.NumberOfLoadedNELPolicies
histogram.summary: The number of NEL policies loaded from the store. This is recorded when the NetworkErrorLoggingService requests a load from the backing store, which typically happens upon the first network request after startup.

histogram.name: ReportingAndNEL.NumberOfLoadedNELPolicies2
histogram.summary: The number of NEL policies loaded from the store. This is recorded when the NetworkErrorLoggingService requests a load from the backing store, which typically happens upon the first network request after startup.

histogram.name: ReportingAndNEL.NumberOfLoadedReportingEndpointGroups2
histogram.summary: The number of Reporting endpoint groups loaded from the store. This is recorded when the ReportingCache requests a load from the backing store, which happens upon receipt of the first Report-To header or queued report after startup.

histogram.name: ReportingAndNEL.NumberOfLoadedReportingEndpoints2
histogram.summary: The number of Reporting endpoints loaded from the store. This is recorded when the ReportingCache requests a load from the backing store, which happens upon receipt of the first Report-To header or queued report after startup.

histogram.name: ReportingAndNEL.TimeInitializeDB
histogram.summary: The time (ms) taken to initialize the Reporting and NEL DB. This is recorded when the DB is initialized, which typically occurs upon the first network request after startup.

histogram.name: ReportingAndNEL.WinGetLastErrorInitializeDB
histogram.summary: The result of calling ::GetLastError() if initializing the Reporting and NEL database fails catastrophically. This is recorded, on Windows only, if the database initialization fails when the DB initialization attempt is made, which typically occurs upon the first network request after startup. Catastrophic errors are defined in sql::IsErrorCatastrophic.

histogram.name: Reset.ChromeOS.PowerwashDialogShown
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the factory reset dialog was shown. Grouped by the viewtype.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.ResourceLoadingBlocked
histogram.summary: Records if the loading of a resource was blocked because the resource URL matched the resource loading hints. Recorded every time a resource load is requested.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.ResourceLoadingBlocked.ResourceLoadPriority.Allowed
histogram.summary: Records the resource load priority of a resource when its loading is not blocked due to the resource loading hints. Recorded every time a resource load is requested, and the load is not blocked due to the resource loading hints.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.ResourceLoadingBlocked.ResourceLoadPriority.Blocked
histogram.summary: Records the resource load priority of a resource when its loading is blocked due to the resource loading hints. Recorded every time a resource load is requested and the resource load is blocked because the resource URL matched the resource loading hints.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.ResourcePatternsAvailableAtCommitForRedirect
histogram.summary: Records if the resource patterns were available at the time of page commit if the committed previews type was RESOURCE_LOADING_HINTS and the navigation was redirected. This is a subset of the ResourcePatternsAvailableAtCommit histogram.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.DelayableRequests.WaitTimeToAvoidContentionWithNonDelayableRequest
histogram.summary: Records how long after the start of a delayable resource request, a non-delayable resource request arrived. This is the duration of time that the delayable request should have been queued for so as to avoid any network contetion with later-arriving non-delayable requests.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.NonDelayableLastEndToNonDelayableStart.NonDelayableNotInFlight
histogram.summary: The duration of time between the end of a non-delayable resource request to the start of the next non-delayable resource request. Recorded at the start of all non-delayable requests that are preceeded by at least one completed non-delayable request in the same resource scheduler client. Recorded only when a non-delayable request is NOT in-flight.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.NonDelayableLastStartToNonDelayableStart.NonDelayableInFlight
histogram.summary: The duration of time between the start of a non-delayable resource request to the start of the next non-delayable resource request. Recorded at the start of all non-delayable requests that are preceeded by at least one started non-delayable request in the same resource scheduler client. Recorded only when a delayable request is in-flight.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.PeakObservedQueueingDelay
histogram.summary: Within a request's lifetime, the peak observed queueing delay tells whether the request was affected by the network congestion. Records the maximum network queueing delay when the given request was in-flight. This is emitted when the request is completed.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestQueuingDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time the ResourceScheduler queued a request. Recorded in separate histograms based on the request loading priority at the time the request was dequeued.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.WeakSignalThrottling.WeakSignalDuration.{NetworkType}
histogram.summary: Records the duration of the period when some low-priority requests were throttled due to weak radio signal. Only supported on Android.

histogram.name: Rlz.SetRlzPingSent
histogram.summary: Record if updating |should_send_rlz_ping| in RW_VPD is successful within the maximum retry counts.

histogram.name: Rollback.OobeRestoreResult
histogram.summary: The result when attempting to restore data during a ChromeOS rollback.

histogram.name: Rollback.RollbackSaveResult
histogram.summary: The result when attempting to save data during a ChromeOS rollback.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadChecks
histogram.summary:
Records results of SafeBrowsing download url check. Warning: this histogram was expired from M78 to M91. Data may be missing.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadUrlCheckDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for SafeBrowsing to check a download url. Warning: this histogram was expired from M78 to M91. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing service. Logged after a GetHash request finishes to capture the response code or error code for that call. Split out from SB2.GetHashErrorResponseOrErrorCode in M49.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeReportError
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the report error link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.CanCheckUrl
histogram.summary: Count of how many URLs were actually checked vs skipped via RemoteSafeBrowsingDatabaseManager because the scheme is not supported by Safe Browsing. Incremented each time a resource load is initiated.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.CanCheckUrl.{CheckType}
histogram.summary: Count of how many URLs were actually checked by {CheckType} vs skipped via RemoteSafeBrowsingDatabaseManager because the scheme is not supported by Safe Browsing. Incremented each time a resource load is initiated. Different check types are not directly comparable because hash real time checks have applied pre-filtering before this histogram is logged while hash database checks haven't.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.CheckDelta
histogram.summary:
The microseconds between sending the Safe Browsing API call and receiving the response. Logged in java code and does not include any thread hops or extra work. Note that this does include task queue time to respond to the IPC (and that queue time is often non-trivial).
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Latency of URL-classification API calls from Chrome via RemoteSafeBrowsingDatabaseManager, logged per-request. This includes the time to go through JNI, check the URL, and return the result and includes several thread hops betwetween IO and UI threads. The resource-load will not necessarily be delayed this much (see SB2.Delay for that).

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.InternalErrorStatusCode2
histogram.summary: The status code provided by GmsCore if it is unable to respond to a URL check request due to incorrect initialization, not being ready, etc. Logged on each URL check that hits the internal error condition. The total number of these should add up to the INTERNAL_ERROR reports under SB2.RemoteCall.Result.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.Result
histogram.summary: Result of URL-classification API calls from Chrome via RemoteSafetyNetApiHandler. Logged after each URL is judged safe/not-safe, or hits a deadline. The INTERNAL_ERROR cases are further classified under SB2.RemoteCall.InternalErrorStatusCode.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.ThreatSubType.PotentiallyHarmfulApp
histogram.summary: The threat sub-type annotated for URLs classified as PHA via remote calls through RemoteSafeBrowsingApiHandler. "PHA" classifications generate "malware" interstitials.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.ThreatSubType.SocialEngineering
histogram.summary: The threat sub-type annotated returned for URLs classified as social engineering via remote calls through RemoteSafeBrowsingApiHandler. "Social engineering" classifications generate "phishing" interstitials.

histogram.name: SB2.RequestDestination
histogram.summary: Request destinations of resources that were inspected by Safe Browsing in the SafeBrowsingResourceThrottle. kDocument is for a main resource request in a main frame or a Portal. Subframe requests are a combination of kIframe and kFrame.

histogram.name: SB2.ResourceTypes2
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code in M94. Replaced with SB2.RequestDestination.
histogram.summary:
Resource types of resources that were inspected by Safe Browsing in the SafeBrowsingResourceThrottle.
Starting M89, this metric is derived from network::mojom::RequestDestination. kPrefetch, kFavicon, kXhr, kPing, kNavigationPreloadMainFrame, and kNavigationPreloadSubFrame are all mapped to kSubResource.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.UploadDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10-2021 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the TwoPhaseUploader to complete. This is logged on every upload.

histogram.name: SBIRS.DiscardedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident discarded by the safe browsing incident reporting service as a result of profile or service destruction.

histogram.name: SBIRS.DroppedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident given to the safe browsing incident reporting service but dropped as a result of not participating in safe browsing.

histogram.name: SBIRS.Incident
histogram.summary: The type of incident included in an incident report by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.NoDownloadIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident pruned by the safe browsing incident reporting service as a result of not having a matching binary download.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PrunedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident pruned from a report in the safe browsing incident reporting service as a result of having previously been reported.

histogram.name: SBIRS.ReceivedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident received by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.ReportPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The size, in bytes, of a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.UploadResult
histogram.summary: The result of an attempted report upload by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBMultipartUploader.FailedUploadDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2022 due to lack of use and historical stability.
histogram.summary:
Measures the total duration (including delay due to retries) of a failed upload request. This is recorded after the last retry on every failed upload.
Warning: This histogram was expired in M91 and restored in M92. Data may be missing in M91.

histogram.name: SBMultipartUploader.NetworkRequestResponseCodeOrError
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2022 due to lack of use and historical stability.
histogram.summary:
The HTTP response code or net error from each upload attempt. This is recorded once for each network request made as part of an upload, i.e. if an upload fails the first time, but a retry succeeds, this metric is recorded twice.
Warning: This histogram was expired in M91 and restored in M92. Data may be missing in M91.

histogram.name: SBMultipartUploader.RetriesNeeded
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2022 due to lack of use and historical stability.
histogram.summary:
Counts how many retries were needed to complete the upload request. This is emitted for every successful upload.
Warning: This histogram was expired in M91 and restored in M92. Data may be missing in M91.

histogram.name: SBMultipartUploader.SuccessfulUploadDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2022 due to lack of use and historical stability.
histogram.summary:
Measures the total duration (including delay due to retries) of a successful upload request. This is recorded for every successful upload.
Warning: This histogram was expired in M91 and restored in M92. Data may be missing in M91.

histogram.name: SBMultipartUploader.UploadSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2022 due to lack of use and historical stability.
histogram.summary:
The size of the upload request body. This is a combination of the upload data and metadata. This is recorded once for each upload, regardless of whether it was successful.
Warning: This histogram was expired in M91 and restored in M92. Data may be missing in M91.

histogram.name: SBMultipartUploader.UploadSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2022 due to lack of use and historical stability.
histogram.summary:
Whether the overall upload request succeeded or not. This is recorded once for an upload request, regardless of how many retries were needed to complete the upload.
Warning: This histogram was expired in M91 and restored in M92. Data may be missing in M91.

histogram.name: ScreenLocker.AuthenticationFailure
histogram.summary: What type of authentication was attempted when the user failed to unlock the lock screen.

histogram.name: ScreenLocker.AuthenticationFailureTime
histogram.summary: The time spent for authentication in case of a failure.

histogram.name: ScreenLocker.AuthenticationSuccess
histogram.summary: What type of authentication was attempted when the user successfully unlocked the lock screen.

histogram.name: ScreenLocker.AuthenticationSuccessTime
histogram.summary: The time spent for authentication in case of a success.

histogram.name: ScreenLocker.ScreenLockTime
histogram.summary: The time spent before the screen locker is ready.

histogram.name: ScreenLocker.{LockState}.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration for the screen to be in locked/unlocked state. Recorded inside ScreenlockMonitor, when the screen lock state changes.

variant.name: Locked
variant.summary: screen was locked in this duration.

variant.name: Unlocked
variant.summary: screen was unlocked in this duration.

histogram.name: SendTabToSelf.ClickResult
histogram.summary:
Records user flow for SendTabToSelf feature.
Because each bucket represents a different aspect of the flow, it's important to look at "bucket count", not "bucket proportion".
On iOS this was not recorded between M85 and M90, inclusive (see crbug.com/1204944).
This expired 2022/10 and got revived 2023/07, some data will be missing.

histogram.name: ServicesCustomization.LoadResult
histogram.summary: Records result of fetching and parsing OEM customization manifest. See ServicesCustomizationDocument class for more info. Used only on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Servicification.Startup2
histogram.summary: Histogram of how Chrome is launched, either in ServiceManager only mode or as full browser, as well as either cold start or warm start. See go/servicification_startup_metrics for more details.

histogram.name: Servicification.Startup3
histogram.summary: Histogram of how Chrome is launched, either in ServiceManager only mode or as full browser, as well as either cold start or warm start. See go/servicification_startup_metrics for more details. The UMA data is cached in the SharedPreference compared with Servicification.Startup2, which might lose some data when Chrome is running in the ServiceManager only mode.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.AddAppContainerAce
histogram.summary: True if the the installer successfully added AppContainer ACEs to the application directory during installation and updating.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.CumulativeDiskUsage2
histogram.summary: The cumulative disk usage in MB during install or uninstall attempt, recorded right after the install/uninstall attempt on windows only.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteAppLauncherClientsKey
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy "app launcher" Clients key is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteBinariesClientsKey
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy "binaries" Clients key is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteIExecuteCommandClassKey
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the COM registration for the legacy "IExecuteCommand" implementation class key is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteInstallExtensionCommand
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy "install-extension" app command is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.LzmaUnPackStatus
histogram.summary: Record the status of unpacking the contents of a 7z file.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.PeakPagefileUsage
histogram.summary: The peak page file usage by setup.exe in KB during install or uninstall attempt.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.PeakWorkingSetSize
histogram.summary: The peak working set size of setup.exe in KB during install or uninstall attempt.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.RemoveProfileStatistics
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M100 (expired a long time ago).
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy profile count keys / values are deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.Result
histogram.summary: The final exit-result of the entire run of setup.exe on Windows.

histogram.name: SharedMemory.MapBlockedForSecurity
histogram.summary: Tracks whether an attempt to map shared memory was blocked due to too much shared memory already being mapped into the address space.

histogram.name: ShortcutsProvider.DatabaseSize
histogram.summary: The number of entries in shortcuts backend's database when initialized, which happens during profile load.

histogram.name: Shutdown.BrowserExit.Time2
histogram.summary: Time duration for shutdown initiated by the browser exit menu command. The duration covers from the shutdown trigger to the deletion of the BrowserImpl. Note: Android does not have shutdown metrics.

histogram.name: Shutdown.EndSession.Time2
histogram.summary: Time duration for shutdown initiated by an end session (user logs off, shuts down or reboots without explicitly exiting).The duration covers from the shutdown trigger to the deletion of the BrowserImpl. Note: Android does not have shutdown metrics.

histogram.name: Shutdown.NotValid.Time2
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown for a not valid exit. This situation happen when a chrome process is already running and the process is terminated after the process singleton rendez-vous. The duration covers from the shutdown trigger to the deletion of the BrowserImpl. Note: Android does not have shutdown metrics.

histogram.name: Shutdown.OtherExit.Time2
histogram.summary: Time duration for clean shutdown that are not catched by other not initiated by the users. The duration covers from the shutdown trigger to the deletion of the BrowserImpl. Note: Android does not have shutdown metrics.

histogram.name: Shutdown.ShutdownType2
histogram.summary:
The action type that triggered a browser shutdown. The metric is emitted just after BrowserImpl deletion. Note: Android does not have shutdown metrics.
In M-108, the detection of shutdown due to early exit paths changed and these shutdowns will be moved from the NotValid bucket to the Other bucket.

histogram.name: Shutdown.SilentExit.Time2
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown for a silent exit. The duration covers from the shutdown trigger to the deletion of the BrowserImpl. Note: Android does not have shutdown metrics.

histogram.name: Shutdown.WindowClose.Time2
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the last browser window being closed. The duration covers from the shutdown trigger to the deletion of the BrowserImpl. Note: Android does not have shutdown metrics.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.CertificateFetch.CacheHit
histogram.summary: Records if the fetched Signed Exchange certchain was served from HTTP cache or not.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.CertVerificationResult
histogram.summary: Reports the result of Signed Exchange cert verification, including success.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.CTVerificationResult
histogram.summary: Reports the result of Signed Exchange CT verification, including success.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.FallbackRedirectLoop
histogram.summary:
Records true when a fallback redirect of Signed Exchange has failed with ERR_TO_MANY_REDIRECTS.
Total count of SignedExchange.LoadResult2 should be used as a baseline of this histogram.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.LoadResult2
histogram.summary: Records the result of loading a resource from Signed HTTP Exchange. Emitted each time a response is handled as Signed Exchange.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.OCSPResponseStatus
histogram.summary: The status of OCSP response in Signed Exchange certificates. Reported each time Signed Exchange's OCSP check is performed.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.OCSPRevocationStatus
histogram.summary: Reports the revocation status of OCSP response in Signed Exchange certificates. Emitted when Signed Exchange's OCSP check is performed, but only when an up-to-date OCSP response was stapled.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.Prefetch.LoadResult2
histogram.summary: Records if the prefetched Signed Exchange was properly formatted and passed verification steps. Reported for each completed SignedExchange prefetch.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.SignatureVerificationError.Expired
histogram.summary: Recorded when Signed Exchange signature was expired. Records the time delta between current time and signature's "expires" value.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.SignatureVerificationError.NotYetValid
histogram.summary: Recorded when Signed Exchange signature was not yet valid. Records the time delta between current time and signature's "date" value.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.SignatureVerificationResult
histogram.summary: Reports the result of Signed Exchange signature verification, including success.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.Time.CertificateFetch.Failure
histogram.summary: The amount of time elapsed to fetch certificate chain from certUrl, for which the fetch has failed.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.Time.CertificateFetch.Success
histogram.summary: The amount of time elapsed to fetch certificate chain from certUrl, for which the fetch has succeeded.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.Time.SignatureVerify
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during SignedExchangeSignatureVerifier::Verify.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.TimeUntilExpiration
histogram.summary: Number of seconds until the Signed Exchange's expiration time. Recorded when Signed Exchange signature verification is performed, and emitted only for Signed Exchanges within the validity period.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.Behaviour
histogram.summary:
The behaviour of site isolated javascript code cache recorded for each cache transaction. It records if the request was serviced and if serviced how it was serviced for ex: hit, miss, update.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-07-24 to 2023-04-03; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.FetchCodeCache
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent to fetch a code cache. Recorded only for a JS code cache, and recorded only when a non-empty code cache is found.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.Hit
histogram.summary: Represents whether fetching from the code cache succeeded. Recorded when the code cache result gets available.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.MemoryBackedCodeCachePotentialImpact
histogram.summary: The amount of time that could be saved if we had a memory-backed code cache. Recorded when the code cache result gets available.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.PotentialMemoryBackedCodeCacheHit
histogram.summary: Represents whether fetching from the memory-backed code cache would succeed. Recorded when the code cache result gets available.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.PotentialMemoryBackedCodeCacheSize2
