histogram.summary: Represents the (hypothetical) size of the memory-backed code cache. Recorded for every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.WebUI.Behaviour
histogram.summary: The behaviour of site isolated WebUI JS code cache recorded for each cache transaction. It records if the request was serviced and if serviced how it was serviced for ex: hit, miss, update.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.WASM.Behaviour
histogram.summary:
The behaviour of site isolated web assembly code cache recorded for each cache transaction during WASM compilation. It records if the request was serviced and if serviced how it was serviced for ex: hit, miss, update.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-04-19 to 2023-04-03; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Skia.DrawScaleFactor
histogram.summary: The scale factor of any images drawn by Skia.

histogram.name: Skia.DrawTiled
histogram.summary: Whether a call to drawBitmap(Rect) or drawImage(Rect) used the tiled or non-tiled rasterization path.

histogram.name: Skia.FilterQuality
histogram.summary: The count of images drawn by Skia with a given filter quality.

histogram.name: Skia.LockTexturePath
histogram.summary: The path taken by Skia when it attempts to lock a texture for use.

histogram.name: Skia.SubmitRenderPasses
histogram.summary: The number of Skia render passes sent to the GPU during a GrContext::submit call. The max value that is sent here is 100 so anything in the 100 bucket actually includes render pass counts of 100+. Though we don't expect to be reaching 100 render passes often. This is collected each time we submit to the GPU in Skia.

histogram.name: Skia.VulkanMemoryAllocator.AmountAllocated
histogram.summary: The total amount of memory that the GrVkMemoryAllocator used by Skia's Vulkan backend has allocated. This is GPU memory for VkImages and VkBuffers. Note that the allocator may be shared with other users outside of Skia and this amount includes their uses as well. This is collected each time we request an allocation from Skia.

histogram.name: Skia.VulkanMemoryAllocator.PercentUsed
histogram.summary: The percent of allocated memory that is in use by the GrVkMemoryAllocator used by Skia's Vulkan backend. This is GPU memory for VkImages and VkBuffers. Note that the allocator may be shared with other users outside of Skia and this includes their allocations as well. This is collected each time we request an allocation from Skia.

histogram.name: Snackbar.Shown
histogram.summary: Records the identifier of a snackbar every time one is shown.

histogram.name: SpecialLocale.PromotionDialog
histogram.summary: Records how users interact with the special locale promotion dialog.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Android.Available
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2021/10: This histogram was added as part of an investigation that has been completed.
histogram.summary:
Whether the Android spellchecking service was available at the start of a new spellchecking session. Note that the user can disable the Android spellchecking service in settings, in which case it will show up as not available in the histogram.
Warning: for chrome versions 78-88 this histogram was listed as expired, so for that period the data might be missing or incomplete.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.Android.Latency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2021/10: This histogram was added as part of an investigation that has been completed.
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to receive results from the spellchecking service on Android. More precisely this is the SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() between the SpellCheckerSession.getSentenceSuggestions() and the invocation of the onGetSentenceSuggestions() callback.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.api.async
histogram.summary:
The length of text checked via async checking.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.api.check
histogram.summary:
The length of text checked by spellCheck. No replacement suggestions were requested.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.api.check.suggestions
histogram.summary:
The length of text checked by spellCheck. Replacement suggestions were requested.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.CheckedWords
histogram.summary:
The number of words checked within a session.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.CheckedWordsPerHour
histogram.summary: The average number of words checked per hour. Sampled every 30 minutes. Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.Enabled
histogram.obsolete: Logged on profile open, including for profiles that do not use this setting (such as "system" profiles) and for profiles that do not allow the profile-owner to to configure this setting (such as "guest" profiles). When logged in such cases, reported the default value. Replaced in M-114 with the histogram SpellCheck.Enabled2, which is similar yet only emitted for regular profiles.
histogram.summary:
The number of sessions that started with spellchecking enabled.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.Enabled2
histogram.summary: The number of sessions that started with spellchecking enabled. Recorded only for regular profiles. (Not recorded on guest profiles for example.)

histogram.name: SpellCheck.MisspelledWords
histogram.summary:
The number of misspelled words within a session.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.MisspellRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2021/01: the relevant code path isn't used anymore.
histogram.summary: The percentage of misspelled words within checked words.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.ReplacedWords
histogram.summary:
The number of misspelled-but-replaced words within a session.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.ReplaceRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2021/01: the relevant code path isn't used anymore.
histogram.summary: The percentage of replaced words within misspelled words.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.ShownSuggestions
histogram.summary:
The number of occurrences that shows spelling suggestion within a session. This is incremented and logged when a context menu with spelling suggestions is shown for a misspelled word.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M83 to M107; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.Enabled
histogram.obsolete: Logged on profile open, including for profiles that do not use this setting (such as "system" profiles) and for profiles that do not allow the profile-owner to to configure this setting (such as "guest" profiles). When logged in such cases, reported the default value. Replaced in M-114 with the histogram SpellCheck.SpellingService.Enabled2, which is similar yet only emitted for regular profiles.
histogram.summary: Whether the user has opted in to asking Google for spelling suggestions. Recorded both when spelling is initialized and when the preference is changed.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.Enabled2
histogram.summary: Whether the user has opted in to asking Google for spelling suggestions. Recorded only for regular profiles. (Not recorded on guest profiles for example.) Recorded both when spelling is initialized and when the preference is changed.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time, in ms, between the moment the SimpleURLLoader starts downloading the request and the moment the SimpleURLLoader callback is invoked after the request finishes, whether an error or a success.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.RequestHttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The HTTP code of Spelling service responses.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.RequestResultType
histogram.summary: Describes the results returned by the Spelling service by assigning them to one of three high-level buckets: request/service error, success with no suggestions, and success with spelling suggestions.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SuggestionHitRatio
histogram.summary: The percentage of replacement executions within suggestion occurrences.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.ChromeLocalesSupport
histogram.obsolete: Logged on profile open, including for profiles that do not use this setting (such as "system" profiles) and for profiles that do not allow the profile-owner to to configure this setting (such as "guest" profiles). When logged in such cases, reported the default value. Replaced in M-114 with the histogram Spellcheck.Windows.ChromeLocalesSupport2.*, which are similar yet only emitted for regular profiles.
histogram.summary:
Counts how many languages are added to Chrome by the user but are not supported for spell check (today Chrome only supports a hard-coded list of locales for spell check).
This is a measure of the potential impact of adding support for non-Hunspell locales in the spell check settings. This also helps answer the following question: should the Chrome spell check settings raise awareness of Windows language packs and / or link to documentation describing how to install a Windows language pack?
This is recorded once during spell check initialization, and then once each time the user changes their Chrome languages.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.ChromeLocalesSupport2
histogram.summary:
Counts how many languages are added to Chrome by the user but are not supported for spell check (today Chrome only supports a hard-coded list of locales for spell check). Recorded only for regular profiles. (Not recorded on guest profiles for example.)
This is a measure of the potential impact of adding support for non-Hunspell locales in the spell check settings. This also helps answer the following question: should the Chrome spell check settings raise awareness of Windows language packs and / or link to documentation describing how to install a Windows language pack?
This is recorded once during spell check initialization, and then once each time the user changes their Chrome languages.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.SpellcheckLocalesSupport
histogram.obsolete: Logged on profile open, including for profiles that do not use this setting (such as "system" profiles) and for profiles that do not allow the profile-owner to to configure this setting (such as "guest" profiles). When logged in such cases, reported the default value. Replaced in M-114 with the histogram Spellcheck.Windows.SpellcheckLocalesSupport2.*, which are similar yet only emitted for regular profiles.
histogram.summary:
Of all the currently enabled spell check languages, counts how many are supported by the different spell checkers (Hunspell and the Windows OS).
This helps measure the impact and reach of the native spell checker integration.
This is recorded once during spell check initialization, and then once each time the user changes their enabled spell check languages.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.SpellcheckLocalesSupport2
histogram.summary:
Of all the currently enabled spell check languages, counts how many are supported by the different spell checkers (Hunspell and the Windows OS). Recorded only for regular profiles. (Not recorded on guest profiles for example.)
This helps measure the impact and reach of the native spell checker integration.
This is recorded once during spell check initialization, and then once each time the user changes their enabled spell check languages.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.SpellcheckRequestDuration
histogram.summary:
Measures the time it takes to perform one spell check end to end. The start time is taken just before invoking Hunspell or the native spell checker (via Mojo), and the end time is taken just before invoking the Blink spell check callback.
This is recorded every time a spell check is performed.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.SuggestionGatheringDuration
histogram.summary:
Measures the time it takes to generate spelling suggestions when a user right clicks a misspelled word. The start time is taken just before invoking Hunspell for the suggestions, and the end time is taken just after the final suggestion list is constructed.
This is recorded every time the user opens the context menu on a misspelled word, but only if the suggestions hadn't been pre-generated (which happens when all spell check locales are supported by the OS spell checker).

histogram.name: SSL.CertificateErrorReportEvent
histogram.summary:
Users can opt in to send reports of certificate validation errors to Google. This records the outcome whenever Chrome sends such a report.
Some certificate validation reports might not be received because proxies, firewalls or other content filters might filter report uploads.

histogram.name: SSL.CertificateErrorReportFailure
histogram.summary: Users can opt in to send reports of certificate validation errors to Google. This records the error code whenever Chrome fails to send such a report.

histogram.name: SSL.ExpectCTReportFailure2
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M77, code removed in M98
histogram.summary: Sites can opt in to Expect CT, a reporting feature that sends a report whenever a TLS connection does not have valid Certificate Transparency information associated with it. This records the error code when Chrome fails to send an Expect CT report.

histogram.name: SSL.ExpectCTReportSendingAttempt
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M77, code removed in M98
histogram.summary: Sites can opt in to Expect CT, a reporting feature that sends a report whenever a TLS connection does not have valid Certificate Transparency information associated with it. This metric fires whenever Chrome attempts to send an Expect CT report.

histogram.name: SSL.Experimental.SubresourceResponse
histogram.summary: The histogram is being used to track the number of messages (content::mojom::FrameHost::SubresourceResponseStarted IPCs) resulting in no-op (i.e. returning without doing anything) but requiring an IPC vs messages which revoke exceptions after seeing a good certificate when calling SSLManager::DidStartResourceResponse() from RenderFrameHostImpl::SubresourceResponseStarted(). We are not interested in calls to SSLManager::DidStartResourceResponse() from ReadyToCommitNavigation since they don't involve mojo messages. From local benchmarks, we observe this request causes significant IPC chatter, and this histogram will help us understand it better.

histogram.name: SSL.InsecureContent
histogram.obsolete: Expired in 02/2020. Code removed in M98.
histogram.summary: Keeps track of various insecure content events, such as loading an HTTP script from an HTTPS page.

histogram.name: SSL.NonWebbyMixedContentLoaded
histogram.summary: Tracks when mixed content is loaded from a "non-webby" URL, e.g. an external protocol. The security of such URLs is unknown, but they are exempt from mixed content UI treatment because they don't usually return data to the browser. This histogram tracks how often such content is loaded so that we can decide whether to block such resources unless an enterprise policy is enabled.

histogram.name: SSORecallPromo.AccountsAvailable
histogram.summary: Number of accounts available for Single Sign On with the current device, recorded at the time the SSO Promo is shown.

histogram.name: SSORecallPromo.PromoAction
histogram.summary: Action the user takes when the Single Sign On promotion is shown.

histogram.name: SSORecallPromo.PromoSeenCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the promotion has been seen on the current device.

histogram.name: Style.InvalidationTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds spent in StyleEngine::InvalidateStyle. Only samples from high resolution timers are recorded.

histogram.name: Style.RebuildLayoutTreeTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds spent in RebuildLayoutTree called from Document::UpdateStyle.

histogram.name: Style.RecalcTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds spent in RecalcStyle called from Document::UpdateStyle.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.BundleFetchErrorCode
histogram.summary: The net error code recorded when request for a subresource web bundle was failed.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.ContentLength
histogram.summary: The value of content length header of a subresource web bundle, or zero if the content-length header is missing.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.LoadResult
histogram.summary: The result of loading subresource web bundles.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.MaxMemoryUsagePerProcess
histogram.summary: The max memory usage per renderer process for subresource web bundles which are kept in the network process's memory. Recorded when all the subresource web bundles for the renderer process are released.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.OriginType
histogram.summary: The counts of Web Bundles origin types requested by Subresource Loading with Web Bundles. Recorded when a script element whose type is webbundle is inserted into a document.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.ReceivedSize
histogram.summary: The received data size of a subresource web bundle. Recorded when received all the body of the subresource web bundle.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.ResourceCount
histogram.summary: The number of resources contained in a web bundle. Recorded when bundle metadata is received and parsed successfully.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FailedRequestErrorCode
histogram.summary: The counts of network error codes encountered by SuggestionsService when an attempt to fetch suggestions from the server fails.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: The counts of HTTP response codes encountered by SuggestionsService when attempting to fetch suggestions from the server.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FetchSuccessLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a SuggestionsService fetch that results in a success response.

histogram.name: Suggestions.LocalBlacklistSize
histogram.summary: Number of URLs present in the Suggestions local blacklist when the Suggestions service is created.

histogram.name: Suggestions.ResponseState
histogram.summary: The counts of response states (such as empty or invalid) encountered by SuggestionsService when attempting to fetch suggestions from the server.

histogram.name: Tablet.AppDrag.EndWindowState
histogram.summary: Drag an app window from top in tablet mode will result in different window states. Logged when the app drag ended to record the window end state.

histogram.name: Tablet.AppWindowDrag.CountOfPerUserSession
histogram.summary: The number of the action that drag an app window from top in tablet mode. Logged when the TabletModeController is destructed, which means the user session is ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.AppWindowDrag.InSplitView.CountOfPerUserSession
histogram.summary: The number of the action that drag an app window from top in tablet mode when splitview is active. Logged when the TabletModeController is destructed, which means the user session is ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.CountOfVolumeAdjustType
histogram.summary: The number of each volume adjust type in tablet mode. Logged when starts volume adjust while in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Tablet.TabDrag.CountOfPerUserSession
histogram.summary: The number of the action that drag a tab of the browser window in tablet mode. Logged when the TabletModeController is destructed, which means the user session is ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.TabDrag.DragType
histogram.summary: The type of a tab drag done in tablet mode. Logged when start to drag a tab of the browser window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Tablet.TabDrag.InSplitView.CountOfPerUserSession
histogram.summary: The number of the action that drag a tab of the browser window in tablet mode when splitview is active. Logged when the TabletModeController is destructed, which means the user session is ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.WindowDrag.DragEndEventType
histogram.summary: The type of the window (app window or tab strip) drag end event in tablet mode. Logged when the window drag in tablet mode ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.WindowDrag.OpenedWindowsNumber
histogram.summary: The number of windows in overview when dragging a window from top in tablet mode. Logged when start the window drag and overview has been opened behind.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Certificates.Microsoft
histogram.summary: The total number of certificates for modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed by Microsoft. A catalog counts as a single certificate, and may refer to many modules. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Certificates.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of certificates for modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. A catalog counts as a single certificate, and may refer to many modules. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between 2019-12-31 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.GetDriveLetterPathFound
histogram.summary: Records whether an equivalent driver letter path was found for a device path. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Heartbeat.BlockedModulesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of modules that were blocked from loading into the browser process by the third-party DLL blocking feature. This is recorded every 5 minutes. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Heartbeat.PrintingWorkaround.BlockingEnabled
histogram.summary: Records whether or not Chrome is still blocking third-party DLLs. This is a bit that turns to false when the in-process printing is invoked. Recorded every 5 minutes. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Heartbeat.UniqueBlockedModulesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of unique modules that were blocked from loading into the browser process by the third-party DLL blocking feature. This is recorded every 5 minutes. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.InputMethodEditorsCount
histogram.summary: The number of registered input method editors found on the user's machine. This is emitted shortly after startup when the IME enumeration takes place. This histogram was expired between M77 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Loaded
histogram.summary: The total number of third-party modules (neither Microsoft nor Google) that are loaded in the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.NotLoaded
histogram.summary: The total number of third-party modules (neither Microsoft nor Google) that are not yet loaded in the browser process, but may potentially be (shell extensions, for example). Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between 2019-12-31 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed
histogram.summary: The total number of signed modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between 2019-12-31 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed.Catalog
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed via a catalog. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between 2019-12-31 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed.Microsoft
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed by Microsoft. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Unsigned
histogram.summary: The total number of unsigned modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.ShellExtensionsCount3
histogram.summary: The number of registered shell extensions found on the user's machine. This is emitted shortly after startup when the shell extensions enumeration is done. Doesn't count duplicates. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Uninstallable
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a loaded third party module could be uninstalled using the Windows Apps & Features page. This histogram was expired between M85 and M114.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.CopyFromSurfaceTime
histogram.summary: While taking a screenshot of the current tab for use as a thumbnail, the time it took to copy the tab's contents into a bitmap.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.Gradient.ImageDetectionTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to detect whether a thumbnail requires a gradient overlay. This is run when thumbnails are downloaded for content suggestions, as they load and the result is cached for future use. It is Android specific.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.Gradient.ImageRequiresGradient
histogram.summary: Whether a thumbnail used for a suggestions image requires a gradient to be overlaid to not fade into the background. It applies to the thumbnails used for content suggestions and is Android specific.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.ProcessBitmapTime
histogram.summary: While taking a screenshot of the current tab for use as a thumbnail, the time it took to post-process the captured bitmap.

histogram.name: TileManager.ExceededMemoryBudget
histogram.obsolete: Removed Sept 2021 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Measures whether the tile manager exceeded the hard GPU memory budget (OOMed). Recorded each time the tile manager assigns GPU memory to tiles.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Event
histogram.summary: Events in TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Http response codes in TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseFailureTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (failed) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseSuccessTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (successfull) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Result of TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Retries
histogram.summary: Number of retries until the final response was recorded.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ChromeLabs.{State}LabAction
histogram.summary:
Chrome Labs features user-facing experiments through a button in the toolbar.
This metric tracks which experiment (also called lab in the context of Chrome Labs) a user selects {State} for. This histogram is emitted to when {State} is selected in the combobox of the ChromeLabs dialog.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ShowToolsMenuResponsiveness
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the event that triggers the presentation of the tools menu (the main menu of actions accessed from the toolbar), and the actual appearance of the menu on screen. Includes the animation duration.

histogram.name: Toolbar.TabSwitcher.NewIncognitoTabPresentationDuration
histogram.summary: The number of millseconds between the user requesting a new incognito tab, from within the tab switcher, e.g. by tapping the New Tab button from the tab switcher UI, and it completing its animation on screen.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Device
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad device state.

histogram.name: Touchpad.HapticClickSensitivity.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad haptic click sensitivity setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.HapticClickSensitivity.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad haptic click sensitivity setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.HapticFeedback.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad haptic feedback setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.HapticFeedback.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad haptic feedback setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Changed
histogram.summary:
Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-06-15 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed
histogram.summary:
Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed metric. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-06-15 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started
histogram.summary:
Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started metric. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-06-15 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Touchpad.ScrollAcceleration
histogram.summary:
Whether touchpad scroll acceleration is enabled. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-12-01 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Touchpad.ScrollSensitivity
histogram.summary:
Touchpad scroll sensitivity value. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-12-01 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Changed
histogram.summary:
Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-06-15 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Started
histogram.summary:
Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-06-15 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Changed
histogram.summary:
Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-06-15 to M105; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: TouchScreen.MissedTOUCHEVENTF_UP
histogram.summary:
Recorded when a touch event excludes an active touch (a touch-id/dwId that previously generated a TOUCHEVENTF_DOWN, and has not since generated a TOUCHEVENTF_UP). Chromium generates a simulated event to maintain consistency/correctness. Only recorded on Windows.
Warning: This histogram was expired after M95, and resurrected in M108.
This workaround will be removed once usage drops off. See https://crbug.com/811273 for details.

histogram.name: Touchscreen.TouchEventsEnabled
histogram.summary:
Tracks whether Touch Event Feature Detection is enabled. This is based on the touch events enabled flag and the presence of a touchscreen.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.
NOTE: This metric was incorrectly recorded on Chrome OS for versions 42 through 45, see http://crbug.com/499476 for more details. As of http://crbug.com/644318, we changed the internal name to TouchEventFeatureDetection, but we still keep the old histogram name here to keep consistensy.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.CompressedTraceSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, in kilobytes, of a compressed trace ready to be uploaded. Values can range from 1KB to 100MB.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.FinalizationDisallowedReason
histogram.summary: Reason why background tracing finalization was not allowed. Also see "Tracing.Background.ScenarioState" metric, which records the total number of times finalization was allowed and not allowed.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.FinalizingTraceSizeInKB2
histogram.summary: The size, in kilobytes, of a finalized trace ready to be uploaded. Values can range from 1KB to 100MB. This replaces Tracing.Background.FinalizingTraceSizeInKB, which had a minimum of 1MB and was not precise enough for WebView traces.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.ScenarioState
histogram.summary: Records state of the Background Tracing system, from when scenarios are attempted to be activated until they're completed (successfully or failed)

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.UploadingTraceSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, in kilobytes, of a trace about to be uploaded. Values can range from 1KB to 100MB.

histogram.name: Tracing.SharedBufferIsValid
histogram.summary: Records success or failure of creating the shared buffer in ProducerClient::InitSharedMemoryIfNeeded()

histogram.name: UI.DeviceScale
histogram.summary: The device scales available on the system at startup. A system may report more than one if it has multiple displays with varying device scales. Only logged on Windows.

histogram.name: UI.ScreenWin.UpdateDisplaysTime
histogram.summary: Records the time spent in UpdateAllDisplaysAndNotify. Only logged on Windows.

histogram.name: UncompressAndParseSkiaVectorAsset
histogram.summary: Records the time spent in uncompressing a gzipped animation file.

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.MakeSearchesAndBrowsingBetter.OnProfileLoad
histogram.summary: State of the user settings for making searches and browsing better, recorded each time a regular profile is loaded (this histogram is not recoded for system profiles, guest profiles, off-the-record profiles or irregular ChromeOS profiles).

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.MakeSearchesAndBrowsingBetter.OnStartup
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2023/01 in favor of UnifiedConsent.MakeSearchesAndBrowsingBetter.OnProfileLoad as histogram UnifiedConsent.MakeSearchesAndBrowsingBetter.OnStartup was also recorded for all profiles, including system, guest and other irregular ChromeOS profiles.
histogram.summary: State of the user settings for making searches and browsing better, recorded each time a profile was loaded. Note: Starting with CL https://crrev.com/c/3913924 (M109), this histogram was no longer recorded for System, Guest and other irregular profiles on desktop and ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.SyncAndGoogleServicesSettings.AfterAdvancedOptIn.SyncDataTypesOff
histogram.summary: All *off* sync data types are recorded when the user confirmed the sync setup after going through the advanced opt-in flow.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.BackgroundDownloaderMac.DownloadResultRequestorKnown
histogram.summary: Whether the requestor of a background download was known. Recorded each time a download completes.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.BackgroundDownloaderMac.StartDownloadOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of a download start request. Recorded once each time a download is requested.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.BackgroundDownloaderWin.ExistingJobUsed
histogram.summary: Whether an existing BITS task was reused or created when a download was requested.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.BackgroundDownloaderWin.StaleDownloadAge
histogram.summary: The age of unclaimed downloads when they were removed from the cache.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.BackgroundDownloaderWin.StaleJobsCleaned
histogram.summary: Counts the number of stale jobs that were cleaned each time a new download starts.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.Component.CanUpdateResult
histogram.summary: The result of a CanUpdate check when a component update is offered. Recorded once per check per component.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.Component.UpdateCheckResult
histogram.summary: The result of a component update check. Recorded once per component per update check.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.Component.Updated
histogram.summary: Records when the update client has updated a component.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.CrxDownloader.DownloadCompleteSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether a download completed with an error or not. Recorded once for every completed download.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.CrxDownloader.Fallback
histogram.summary: Records when the CRX Downloader falls back to a different downloader implementation due to errors.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.DaysBeforeUpgrade
histogram.summary:
Measures the days elapsed from an update being visible to the browser and the browser being restarted or quit.
Warning: this histogram expired after M87, and was re-added in M92; data may be missing.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.HoursBeforeUpgrade
histogram.summary: Measures the hours elapsed from an update being visible to the browser and the browser being restarted or quit.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.NotificationStage
histogram.summary: Tracks the upgrade notification stage. This is recorded with every UMA log.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.PollType
histogram.summary: Records the type of poll that first detected an installed version change. Note that a browser that is running while multiple updates are applied will only record this metric once.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.RollbackReason
histogram.summary:
Tracks what is the reason we're doing a rollback instead of an update (going to a more stable channel or admin-initiated enterprise rollback). We're showing different notifications depending on the reason.
Sent when the device finished installing the rollback image, shows the notification and is waiting for reboot.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: Uptime.ChromeExecToLoginPromptVisibleAfterLogout
histogram.summary:
Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when Chrome is started, and when the login prompt is again visible after a logout. This statistic is only collected when preceeded by a logout.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M77 to M96 some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Uptime.DBusCrash
histogram.summary:
The system uptime on Chrome OS when the dbus-daemon process crashes, resulting in a reboot.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M85 to M118 some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Uptime.LoginPromptSetupTimeAfterLogout
histogram.summary:
Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS for setting up for a login after a logout. More specifically, it is the time between when the Cryptohome is unmounted (the last step in the logout process) and when the login prompt is again visible after a logout.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M85 to M96 some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Uptime.Logout
histogram.summary:
Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS when performing a logout. More specifically, it is the time between when a logout is initiated and when the Cryptohome is unmounted, signaling the last step in the logout process. This statistic is not collected when the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/2020 to M96 some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Uptime.LogoutToLoginPromptVisible
histogram.summary:
Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between initiating a logout and the next time the login prompt is visible again. This statistic is not collected if the machine is shutdown between the logout initiation and the prompt becoming visible.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M77 to M96 some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Uptime.LogoutToUIStopAfterLogout
histogram.summary:
Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when a logout is initiated and the UI has stopped (and Chrome has exited) during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M77 to M96 some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Uptime.OtherProcessesTerminatedToChromeExecAfterLogout
histogram.summary:
Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when all user-associated processes have been terminated during the logout process and when Chrome is started again to show the login screen.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M77 to M96 some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Uptime.UIStopToProcessesTerminatedAfterLogout
histogram.summary:
Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when the UI has stopped (Chrome has exited), and when all other associated processes have been terminated during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M77 to M96 some data may be missing.

histogram.name: URL.Host.DidEscape
histogram.summary: Measures whether DoSimpleHost() in url_canon_host.cc escaped any characters in the ASCII table. This is recorded every time a URL hostname is successfully parsed.

histogram.name: URL.Host.EscapeChar
histogram.summary: This histogram records which ASCII characters are escaped in DoSimpleHost(). Each escaped character is recorded separately, but only once for any invocation of DoSimpleHost(). This can potentially be recorded every time a URL hostname is parsed, but only if parsing escaped at least one character.

histogram.name: UsageStats.Events
histogram.summary: Android: count of Usage Stats events. Recorded as these events occur; e.g. when a domain is associated with a token, or a site is suspended.

histogram.name: UserImage.Changed2
histogram.summary:
Distribution of the device images that users changed (Chrome OS). The statistic is recorded each time the user changes their device image to a different one in Settings.
This metric expired in March 2022 and was revived in M105. Data between these times is incomplete.
This metric supersedes `UserImage.Changed` due to a change in enum values.

histogram.name: UserImage.LoggedIn3
histogram.summary:
Distribution of the default images that existing users log in with (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user logs in.
This metric supersedes UserImage.LoggedIn2 due to a change in enum values. Special value 0 (Camera image) of ChromeOSUserImageId2 is never recorded in this histogram.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-03-30 to 2022-08-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: UserImage.ProfileDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download user's profile picture.

histogram.name: UserManager.LoginUserType
histogram.summary: The number of users of different types that log in to the system (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UserManager.LogoutToLoginDelay
histogram.summary: The time between one regular user logging out and a different regular user logging in (Chrome OS). Delays above thirty minutes or which span system reboots or non-regular-user logins are not reported.

histogram.name: UserManager.ProfileEverInitializedMigrationCompleted
histogram.summary: Whether the profile_ever_initialized() user attribute migration has completed for the current user.

histogram.name: UserManager.UserTypeChanged
histogram.summary: This is logged when new user type reported by Gaia is different from the old one (for existing user).

histogram.name: UserSessionManager.RestoreOnCrash.AccountIdValid
histogram.summary: The result of restoring account id on Chrome restart after crash on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Vibration.Context
histogram.summary: Records instances of navigator.vibrate. Includes whether or not it comes with a user gesture, same-origin subframe or cross-origin subframe.

histogram.name: ViewResourceAdapter.GetBitmapInterval
histogram.summary: The interval between ViewResourceAdapter#getBitmap calls.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.ControllerStateTransition
histogram.summary: An integer representing a state transition from x to y in the form of x * 1000 + y. If the transition is not expected, the value is negated. For example an expected transition from SHOWING (= 2) to SHOWN (= 1) is denoted as 2001, and an unexpected transition from SHOWING to SHOWING is denoted as -2002. See KeyboardControllerState for the correspondence between the number and the enum.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.AssistantActionPerformed{Source}
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2023/04 as the Assistant integration project has been calcelled
histogram.summary: Android: The action performed by Assistant upon being invoked during a voice search initiated via the {Source}, such as transcription of a voice search query or translation of the current page. This is recorded after an Assistant intent has completed successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.AssistantIntent.TranslateExtrasAttached
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2023/04 as the Assistant integration project has been calcelled
histogram.summary: Android: Whether Translate extras were successfully attached to an Assistant intent. This is recorded just before the intent is sent to Assistant, and is only recorded if the Translate extras are enabled.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.AudioPermissionEvent{Timing}
histogram.summary: Android: The events related to granting or denying audio permission for system level transcription (as opposite to Assistant). Will be logged {Timing}.

variant.summary: each time non-Assistant voice recognition is triggered with a mic button press

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.DismissedEventSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of a dismissed voice search, such as omnibox or NTP. This is recorded after the dismissed intent returns to Chrome.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.DismissedEventTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of a dismissed voice search, such as the system transcription dialog or Assistant. This is recorded after the dismissed intent returns to Chrome.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.FailureEventSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of a failed voice search, such as omnibox or NTP. This is recorded after any intent failure, which could occur before an intent is sent (if the send fails) or after the intent returns unsuccessfully. It will only be recorded once.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.FailureEventTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of a failed voice search, such as the system transcription dialog or Assistant. This is recorded after any intent failure, which could occur before an intent is sent (if the send fails) or after the intent returns unsuccessfully. It will only be recorded once.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.FinishEventSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of a successful voice search, such as omnibox or NTP. This is recorded immediately after the successful intent returns to Chrome.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.FinishEventTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of a successful voice search, such as the system transcription dialog or Assistant. This is recorded immediately after the successful intent returns to Chrome.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.IllegalContextRequest
histogram.summary: Counts the number of requests to retrieve voice interaction context when no user interaction is initiated.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes between the user clicking the mic and chrome receiving the transcribed voice query. This is recorded after an Assistant intent has completed successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android.Target.{Target}
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes between the user clicking the mic and chrome receiving the transcribed voice query. This is recorded after an Assistant intent has completed successfully. This histogram is limited to intents sent to {Target}. See VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android for the total count across all targets.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android{Action}
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes between the user clicking the mic and chrome receiving the intent response for {Action} actions. This is recorded after an Assistant intent has completed successfully. These per-action variants are recorded only when non-transcription actions are enabled. See VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android for the total count that includes clients with non-transcription actions disabled.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.StartEventSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of a voice search start event, such as omnibox or NTP. This is recorded immediately before the voice transcription intent is sent.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.StartEventTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of a voice search start event, such as the system transcription dialog or Assistant. This is recorded immediately before the voice transcription intent is sent.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.UnexpectedResultSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of an incoming result that doesn't align with an outgoing request from Chrome. This is recorded when the extraneous intent response is received.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.UnexpectedResultTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of an intent result that doesn't align with an outgoing request from Chrome. This is recorded when the extraneous intent response is received.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.UserInteractionToRequestArrival
histogram.summary: Records the time between user interaction and the actual request arrival.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.VoiceResultConfidenceValue
histogram.summary: Android: Records the confidence value of a successful voice search as a percentage. This is recorded when the voice intent returns successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.VoiceResultConfidenceValue.{Target}
histogram.summary: Android: Records the confidence value of a successful voice search as a percentage, limited to intents sent to {Target}. This is recorded when the voice intent returns successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.VoiceSearchResult
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether the voice search produced results. This is recorded when the voice intent returns successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.VoiceSearchResult.{Target}
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether the voice search produced results, limited to intents sent to {Target}. This is recorded when the voice intent returns successfully.

histogram.name: WebContentsObserver.{Method}
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to call all observers of the WebContents observer method {Method}. Logged every time the method is called.

histogram.name: WebContextFetcher.Time.RunJavaScript
histogram.summary: Records the number of milliseconds that it takes for a web context fetch to complete. Recorded when the javascript execution completes. To start will be used for Google Lens image queries to track time to retrieve page context, but may extend to other features over time.

histogram.name: WebController.BackForwardListOutOfSyncInProvisionalNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2021-11, since the WebKit bug whose occurrences were being tracked by this metric no longer reprodcues on iOS 13+.
histogram.summary: [iOS] Records the action take when the backForwardList of the WebView is out of sync with the URL exposed by the WebView when starting a new provisional navigation. The URLs can get out of sync because of a bugs in WebKit. This is only recorded when the URLs are out of sync.

histogram.name: WebController.CertVerificationErrorsCacheHit
histogram.summary: [iOS] Report cache hit/miss for WKWebView cert verification. CRWWKNavigationHandler has a cache of pending cert verification results to avoid extra verifications when presenting SSL interstitial. This metric helps to understand how often this cache miss happens.

histogram.name: WebController.ExternalURLRequestBlocking
histogram.summary: [iOS] Measures the proportion of external URL requests that originate from a subframe without any user interaction (e.g. an advertisement contains an iframe directed at the App Store).

histogram.name: WebDatabase.AutofillWebDataBackendImpl.OperationResult
histogram.summary: Records the success or failure of various database operations in autofill::AutofillWebDataBackendImpl.

histogram.name: WebDatabase.FailedMigrationToVersion
histogram.summary: If a migration to a new WebDatabase schema fails, this histogram records the target version to which the migration failed.

histogram.name: WebDatabase.InitResult
histogram.summary: Records whether WebDatabase::Init succeeds or otherwise a failure reason.

histogram.name: WebDatabase.SucceededMigrationToVersion
histogram.summary: If a migration to a new WebDatabase schema succeeds, this histogram records the target version to which the migration failed.

histogram.name: WebFont.BlankTextShownTime
histogram.summary: A histogram tracking the time we spent showing blank text because a web font wasn't available by the time we needed it. Measured once per @font-face that ended up showing blank text.

histogram.name: WebFont.CacheHit
histogram.summary: Recorded upon web fonts load. Counts the number of times web font is loaded from cache (disk cache or memory cache), fetched over network, or served from data URL.

histogram.name: WebFont.Clients.RenderBlockingFonts.ExpiredFonts
histogram.summary: Recorded when render-blocking web font preloads have reached the maximum blocking time, and therefore, turned into non-render-blocking. Records the number of web font preloads that are still pending. This is a diagnostic metric for feature RenderBlockingFonts.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.0.Under10KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of under 10KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.1.10KBTo50KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 10KB-50KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.2.50KBTo100KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 50KB-100KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.3.100KBTo1MB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 100KB-1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.4.Over1MB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of over 1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.LoadError
histogram.summary: The time taken for a webfont download that failed. Includes aborted requests.

histogram.name: WebFont.FontDisplayValue
histogram.summary: The value of font-display @font-face descriptor. Counted only when explicitly specified in the @font-face rule.

histogram.name: WebFont.HadBlankText
histogram.summary: This metrics is logged when a page that use web fonts is loaded. The value is whether we had to wait on at least one web font and ended up showing blank text, or not.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadLimitOnDiskCacheMiss
histogram.summary: The load limit state when the first disk-cache-only request fails by cache miss, if WebFonts cache-aware timeout adaptation is enabled and applicable.

histogram.name: WebFont.LocalFontUsed
histogram.summary: Whether a locallly installed font is actually used when @font-face had local sources.

histogram.name: WebP.DecodedImageFormat
histogram.summary: Histogram for the format of decoded WebP images on iOS, as Chrome re-encodes WebP images on that platform.

histogram.name: WebShare.ApiCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of calls to navigator.share. Includes both successful and failed shares.

histogram.name: WebShare.ShareOutcome
histogram.summary:
Records the outcome of calls to navigator.share. This will not count any calls that never complete (e.g., if the page closes while the picker is open). Therefore, DO NOT look at the raw percentages of this histogram; instead, compare these numbers with the WebShare.ApiCount.Share total.
NOTE: At the moment, if the user cancels the picker, its recording will be delayed, and possibly never recorded (https://crbug.com/636274), so that will account for a discrepancy between ShareOutcome and ApiCount.Share.

histogram.name: Webstore.ExtensionInstallResult
histogram.summary: The success or failure of all extension installs from the webstore. This includes those initiated by sync.

histogram.name: WebUI.ColorsStylesheetServingDuration
histogram.summary: The time in milliseconds to generate chrome://theme/colors.css and queue it to be sent to the renderer for WebUI. Does not include url parsing time. Recorded for every request for colors.css. Lower is better.

histogram.name: WebUI.CreatedForUrl
histogram.summary: URLs for which Chrome creates WebUIControllers.

histogram.name: WebUI.Settings.PathVisited
histogram.summary: Paths within chrome://settings visited. For evaluating popularity and priorities for chrome://settings GUI. Note that this metric used to include paths that were part of OS settings, but starting with M-81, this metric only records browser settings paths.

histogram.name: WebUI.WebUIURLLoaderFactory.URLRequestLoadTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time for URL requests made through the WebUIURLLoaderFactory. The reported duration is the time spent in the browser process from the reception of the mojo request up to the content delivery through mojo call.

histogram.name: WebUICodeCache.FeatureEnabled
histogram.summary: True if WebUICodeCache feature is enabled. This counts the number of times generated WebUICodeCache JS code cache is instantiated.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.CloseAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how a user closed it.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.CloseTabAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. This records how a user closed a tab within the WebUI tab strip.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.LoadCompletedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the RenderFrameHost StartProvisionalLoad event and the RenderFrameHost DocumentOnLoadCompleted event for the WebUI tab strip page. This happens once when a browser window with WebUI tab strip enabled is created. WebUITabStrip.LoadDocumentTime should be smaller or equal to WebUITabStrip.LoadCoimpletedTime.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.LoadDocumentTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the RenderFrameHost StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the WebUI tab strip page. This happens once when a browser window with WebUI tab strip enabled is created. WebUITabStrip.LoadDocumentTime should be smaller or equal to WebUITabStrip.LoadCoimpletedTime.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.OpenAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how a user opened it.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.OpenDuration
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how long it was open when closing.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabActivation
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time from activating a tab from WebUI to receiving an activation notification in WebUI.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabCreation
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time needed to create all of the tab elements at launch.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabDataReceived
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time from requesting the tab data to receiving the data.

histogram.name: WebUsb.ChooserClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the WebUSB device chooser was closed.

histogram.name: WebUsb.NotificationClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the "WebUSB device detected" notification was dismissed.

histogram.name: WebUsb.PermissionRevoked
histogram.summary: Records when the user revokes permission for an origin to connect to a USB device using the WebUSB API.

histogram.name: WebView.ApiCall
histogram.obsolete: Renamed in M99. Please see "Android.WebView.ApiCall" going forward, which has the same logging behavior.
histogram.summary: Records calls to WebView APIs in WebViewChromium.

histogram.name: Welcome.SignInPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of promoting sign-in via the Welcome page.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.DefaultPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records whether or not Chrome was the default browser when the user left the Win10-specific Welcome page.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.NewPromoPageAdded
histogram.summary: Emits a "true" sample when the revamped WebUI-based welcome page is added to the startup tabs list. This means that barring an error on startup, it was shown to the user. This histogram can only be recorded during first-run flow, when the EnableWelcomeWin10 experiment is enabled.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.OriginalPromoPageAdded
histogram.summary: Emits a "true" sample when the old external welcome page is added to the startup tabs list. This means that barring an error on startup, it was shown to the user. This histogram can only be recorded during first-run flow, when the EnableWelcomeWin10 experiment is disabled.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.PinCheckTimedOut
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the check that verifies if Chrome is pinned to the taskbar has timed out. This check is done when the welcome page is opened in order to determine which instructions to display to the user.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.PinnedPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records whether or not Chrome was pinned to the taskbar when the user left the Win10-specific Welcome page.

histogram.name: WhatsNew.LoadEvent
histogram.summary: Records load events for the What's New page when a load event occurs. This tracks how many times loading remote content is attempted, and whether it succeeds, fails and results in an error page, fails and redirects to the New Tab Page, fails and doesn't open the tab (for preloading), or fails and closes the tab. Load is attempted when the page is first opened or on first startup after updating to a new milestone. Success or failure will occur when the network request completes. Desktop only.

histogram.name: WhatsNew.LoadResponseCode
histogram.summary: Records the net error or HTTP response code of the network request for the remote content for the iframe in the What's New page. This request is triggered when the What's New page is opened. Desktop only.

histogram.name: WhatsNew.StartupType
histogram.summary: Records whether the What's New page should try to show, whether it is overridden (e.g. by welcome) and whether the user is ineligible (e.g. due to being in incognito mode). Recorded when startup tabs are being determined at initialization. Desktop only.

histogram.name: WheelScrolling.WasLatched
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a GSU event with wheel source is latched to the current scrolling element. It is false for the first GSU event of every scrolling sequence and true for the rest of the GSU events.

histogram.name: Win8.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Count of page loads in each of the 2 different environments (metro/desktop) on Windows 8.

histogram.name: WindowOcclusionChanged
histogram.summary: A top level window's occlusion state. Recorded each time the state changes.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.Action
histogram.summary: The type of category clicked in the Windows Jumplist

histogram.name: WorkerThread.ExitCode
histogram.summary: Records the exit code of WorkerThread.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.MenuAction
histogram.summary: Number of times that each menu item is clicked.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.RecentTabsSubMenu
histogram.summary: The number of times each tab or window restore option in the Recent Tabs submenu is clicked.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.TimeToAction.{Action}
histogram.summary: The time a user takes to select a menu item after opening the menu.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.TouchDuration
histogram.summary: Time difference between touch down and touch up on Android wrench button.

histogram.name: X11.XInternAtomFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2021 as enough data was collected.
histogram.summary: Counts how often the X11 server fails to register an atom. Recorded when ::XInternAtom fails (returns None). Failure rates will inform whether we implement error handling. https://crbug.com/1000919

histogram.name: XHR.Async.PageDismissal
histogram.summary: Records occurence of async XHR during page dismissal state (unload, beforeunload, pagehide etc).

histogram.name: XHR.Sync.PageDismissal
histogram.summary: Records occurence of sync XHR during page dismissal state (unload, beforeunload, pagehide etc).

histogram.name: XHR.Sync.PageDismissal_forbidden
histogram.summary: Records occurence of sync XHR requests during page dismissal state (unload, beforeunload, pagehide etc) that were forbidden.
